date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 10, 2018
review_content: These sheets are super soft and very nice.And honestly you can't beat the price.And I know If I went to the store today.I couldn't find any to beat these anyway.$30 and a good night's sleep.Yeah, I think these, I might just keep.Flat sheet, fitted sheet, pillowcases for you.Just go ahead and treat yourself to some too.And If you're reading this review,I hope you enjoyed my rap.Now brb I'm going have a quick nap.Yeah thats right, Im gonna lay on my sheetsTake a deep breath and discover some beats.And if you're looking for me?You might just find me pressing the key"Buy now" immediately"Your new sheets are on their way"Thank you, have a nice day.
title: just a college student procrastinating

author: Jillian M
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 20, 2018
review_content: These might be ok if you have no other sheets to compare them to. I am unsure if I just have a bad set, need to wash them more, or if I am just too high maintenance in the sheet department.With nearly 43,000 reviews and a few Blog posts, I was convinced these 100% polyester sheets would be awesome and they are not. I’ve washed them 4 times and slept on them 5 nights, here are my findings:-Color: these are a much darker grey print than the photo, very pretty but not The intended color.-Fit: they appear to fit our king size bed ok, but I have woken up with a stray corner under me twice.-Feel: it feels like I’m sleeping under a $10 bagged Halloween costume. The texture is soft in some areas and like a raincoat in others. They wrinkle much more than the 800 tc ones I have.-Temperature: These are the hottest sheets I have ever slept under. They are so warm I’ve woken up covered in sweat during/after each use. (We keep our house 67* in the summer, this hardly ever happens with the others)-Construction- they appear to be well put together.Overall I would recommend these for a dorm room, kids room or a guest room to torcher your mother in law. I wish we could return them but we threw out the packing and have washed them too many times hoping for a “breaking them in” miracle. They’ll look good on instagram though!
title: Don’t Buy These If You Already Have Nice Sheets
verified: Size: KingColor: Quatrefoil Silver - GrayVerified Purchase

author: Pragmatic Knee
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 8, 2017
review_content: I have a hard time finding sheets I like. They tend to be too rough for me. Doesn't matter what the thread count, not that I'm even sure what that means or that it's relevant to what I need. Anyway, I tend to stick with soft flannel but need a thinner sheet for summer.I tried some different brands that were always too rough for me, and I was about to go over the top and order a $250 set from Boll and Branch thinking that maybe that was what I had to do.Fortunately, B and R didn't have the color I wanted—at that price you can't settle for anything other than what you want—but I needed a pair of sheets. I saw these and all the positive reviews and gave them a shot. Excellent. And for the price: fanf-ingtastick. Really soft, no scratching or rough feel. These sheets did not require several washes to soften and have held up well to washing. They seem like they may not last forever, and I have noticed a slight run after several months that could turn into a tear, but at the price, I feel like a shorter lifespan can be forgiven.Lots of times the products that come highly recommended on Amazon are just the cheapest thing that a bunch of Walmart regulars thought was a great buy. But these sheets were perfect for me and half the price of the cheapest ones I had tried yet.Recommended.
title: Holy sheet, what a surprise.

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 19, 2018
review_content: We purchased two sets of twin XL for our king split bed. What I like is the feel of the fabric - very soft and providing a little warmth, which is what I was looking for in new sheets for colder weather. What I didn't like: (1) The color of one set does not match the color of the other set, (2) there is a 4" seam opening on one of the pillowcases which I will have to sew closed (3) the pillowcase does not fully cover the pillow because the flap just falls open (4) the stitching detail on the pillowcases is only on one side (5) the fabric feels so incredibly flimsy that I can't imagine these sheets will last through multiple washings (6) I washed this product with a double rinse and a heavy dose of Tide because  there was a strong odor, and that didn't fully remove the odor. I am hoping these sheets last a season, and I will never buy them again. Also, I am wondering why there are so many five-star reviews of these sheets. Yes, the price is terrific, but that's not the only thing to consider about sheets, especially when you spend many hours wrapped up in them every night.
title: Low quality product
verified: Size: Twin XLColor: Light GrayVerified Purchase

author: D. T. Miller
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 27, 2018
review_content: Despite a highly positive recommendation from a friend, I resisted trying microfiber sheets.  Since they are a synthetic fiber, I feared microfiber sheets would be hot in the summer and cold in the winter.  I was wrong; these sheets are what I've been looking for, for many years.In the past, I always purchased mid-level quality cotton sheets; the variation in texture and softness between different brands and fabric weaves left me constantly searching for that "perfectly" soft sheet set.  Furthermore, over the past decade or so, the transitioning of the textile industry from America and Europe to Asia has caused a steady and noticeable decline in the quality of cotton sheets; my last set of cotton sheets, which cost nearly $100 at a well-known bed and bath retailer, lasted just three months before I had worn holes in the area of the sheet directly under my body.The low price of these sheets led me to try them, with low expectations, given the marketing that touted these cheap sheets as "luxury" products; I've read the consumer advisories, and know to ignore the ridiculous thread counts and other such claims on most sheet sets.Opening the packaging, I was surprised by the softness and the seemingly good construction of the set.  After washing (always wash textiles before you wear or use them these days, due to the filthy conditions in factories), the sheets seemed even softer!  The deep pockets of the fitted sheet swallowed my pillow-top mattress, with seemingly enough room for another mattress!  Over the past few months and several washings, the sheets still look brand new, with no appreciable change except for an increasing softness.  The sheets were cozy warm this winter, though I don't know if they will keep me cool in the summer.In short, I have become a microfiber sheet fan (if there is such a thing).  The combination of low price, decent quality, and increasing softness justifies the praise these and other microfiber sheet sets are receiving.
title: I'm a Microfiber Convert

author: Alan D
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 25, 2018
review_content: These sheets are very soft and comfortable I have owned a set of these sheets for about two years they are one of the  Softest  sets  of sheets I have ever owned however there are two things that you should know about the sheets before you  buy  them Number one  they are not Cotton  they are  microfiber  And  very thin if you do not like thin sheets you will not like these number two they do wrinkle  And can become Pillie I am an adult male with A disability  part of that disability means that I have very clammy  sticky hands and feet  when I am sweating my hands and feet will stick to the sheets causing them to wrinkle  however these sheets are so luxurious and amazing that I can overlook that con for me at least but if you are somebody that sweats by with caution  since I have owned them they now have  started wearing  and getting A couple of very small holes in some places but as many of the reviews Have Stated  These  sheets are extremely soft and comfortable I can’t wait to get into bed at night at the time of this review I have just placed an order for two more sets of these sheets hope this helps anyone considering buying them I am  docking two stars because of the fact I do occasionally stick to them and for The holes that have started to wear
title: A review from a sheet snob these sheets are very soft and comfortable BUT...

date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2018
review_content: Compared 5 microfiber bed sheets:THE WINNERS:- Mellanni Bed Sheet Set - Brushed Microfiber 1800 Bedding - Wrinkle, Fade, Stain Resistant - Hypoallergenic - 4 Piece (Queen, Gray)https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00NLLUP4G/ref=od_aui_detailpages00?ie=UTF8&psc=1- Queen Size Bed Sheets Set Gray, Highest Quality Bedding Sheets Set on Amazon, 4-Piece Bed Set, Deep Pockets Fitted Sheet, 100% Luxury Soft Microfiber, Hypoallergenic, Cool & BreathableSold by: TheComfortZonehttps://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00VAOOTCU/ref=od_aui_detailpages00?ie=UTF8&psc=1Both are about equal softness, color, and can be tumble dried. title: Cool & Breathable Sold by

author: The SFC's Wife
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 23, 2017
review_content: These sheets are one heck of a bargain! I'm not going to lie- I was skeptical when I saw the price when I ordered them,  but my great dane managed to tear one of my other sets, and well, desperate times call for desperate measures. I found myself on Amazon- just like you are now,  reading reviews, trying to save a few bucks, but not ending up with the crappiest sheets ever made- the Internet can be terrifying like that (I've been scorned,  can you tell? ).Then I stumbled across these... the Mellanni Bed Sheet Set, and I was SURE I had read the price wrong or that there was some 'catch'. Less than $20 for an ENTIRE sheet SET for my Queen size bed... with mostly positive reviews?? I've paid more than that for 2 pillow cases! There were a large selection of colors to choose from  (I went with the dark brown to go with the hand made quilt on my bed).... still less than $20 for the sheet set- no catch yet. Checked out, paid for,  now we wait...2 days later my precious cargo arrived.  After I ripped that package open like a kid on Christmas, I looked and inspected my new sheets for something,  ANYTHING, to be wrong with them. I got nothing! Now,  you should know,  these ARE a thin sheet- you can practically see through them if you hold them up to the light- but don't let that discourage you.The 'sleep test': I put these suckers on my bed for the TRUE test of any sheet, and oh my... they are fantastic! They are soft. It's like coming home after a long, yucky day at work,  and all you want is to crawl your sorry self into bed for the night,  and your sheets GIVE YOU A HUG all through the night.  But they are breathable,  so you aren't sweating like crazy. Ah-May-Zing!They also wash nicely, they come out soft- but not 'flannel soft', and they fold up neatly  (except for the fitted sheet- only because I don't know how to do that- seriously,  WHO EVEN KNOWS HOW TO FOLD A FITTED SHEET?!??)Would I buy these again? If you even have to guess, then I need to work my my writing skills, because it's absolutely a 'YES' from me! These sheets are honestly one of the best bargains I've ever found online. Less than $20 for a Queen size sheet SET that isn't total crap.... I'm in!
title: Long, but might make you laugh

author: Easy Going Sam
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 13, 2018
review_content: The fitted sheet on the left was not white, as you can see in the photo.  It was not "Silky Soft" as in the description.  The 2 different sheets felt like they were made from to different materials.  The top sheet was white and soft.  The pillow case was also white and soft.  Not sure how something that is obviously not white, gets put into the one for white.
title: Poor quality control.  2 different color sheets.

author: Crashrb
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 30, 2018
review_content: I have two problems with these sheets:1. I washed the sheets before putting them on my bed.  I wash in warm and rinse cold and the sheets shrunk slightly, but not so much I still could not put them on my 18" mattress.  However, the elastic did not hold them in place overnight!2.  This is by far the worst of the two problems...they pill!  I found up to 1/2" fuzz balls from the sheets on the sheets.  At first we thought our dog got under the sheets because we could feel what we thought was clumps of mud in our bed.  Upon closer inspection, they were pilled fabric!I have washed them again.  If they do better with the second use, I'll re-rate, but for now, I am extremely disappointed with these sheets.  I would have thought Amazon would have vetted their lightning products better.UPDATE:  3/20/19 - the pilling problem never improved and the elastic on the bottom sheet was shot after the 4th wash.  They are no drop cloths for painting.  No matter what the price is, steer clear!
title: Who wants sheets that pill up?

author: Michelle Weber
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 17, 2017
review_content: I love these sheets! My husband and I just bought a new bed, and I'm really picky of the sheets we use. I like them so much, I'm planning on ordering a few more sets. The price is completely reasonable for King size, which are normally super expensive. I highly recommend them.
title: I love these sheets
verified: Size: KingColor: Striped – Light BlueVerified Purchase

author: JP
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 29, 2018
review_content: Here’s the thing...this isn’t the first time I’ve purchased Mellanni sheets. Why, you may ask? Simply put, because it’s a great product. If it’s such a great product, why do you keep ordering it? Are they not holding up? Honestly, I can be pretty rough on my sheets. When I am not in bed whilst drinking wine and reading a book or doing some online shopping, my dog (who I insist is part kangaroo) spends her day lounging amidst my bedding, jumping on and off of my bed about three dozen times. Between her eversharp claws and how often I launder my bedding, they have yet to exhibit any signs of wear or loss of colorfastness. Every bed in my home is laden with these sheets - when you find something you like, buy one in every color; at least that’s what they told me. These sheets are great because they are soft, light, and most importantly they breathe. Sheets that don’t breathe are like the time you accidentally threw away that contract and had to go dumpster diving and came out smelling like hot, sweaty garbage. Lord knows what’s growing in there.Here’s the deal - at just short of $30 per set, these are some of the best sheets you can get. Yes, we’ve all probably spent a lot more on sheets than this - triple, quadruple plus...but just buy the sheets and use the money you’ve saved to buy some nice new pillows because it’s probably past time to replace the current ones.
title: The only sheets you ever need

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 18, 2018
review_content: I purchased this set in the coral color about  year ago. I loved the sheets! So soft and durable. However, I purchased a second set in the paisley pattern this time and the material is completely different. The material feels like plastic and is scratchy to the touch. Clearly different material than the sheets I ordered last year.
title: Purchased twice - different material 2nd time

author: flatlander
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 30, 2018
review_content: Micro fiber does not breathe. Like sleeping between shower curtains. Stitching bunchy and elastic too weak to keep the fitted sheet taunt. Pillow slips have odd pocket flap that does not have a purpose since it won’t close over the pillow. The color is pretty and they feel soft but they are inexpensive for these reasons. If it wasn’t such a bother, I’d return them. Very mislead.
title: Hot, flimsy, I’ll fitting

author: earl w whitaker
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 31, 2018
review_content: These are the poorest quality products that I have ever purchased.  I purchased 4 set in two different colors.  They came covered in black fibers on all 4 sets and had to be washed.  The pillow cases are only half hemmed and the one set didn't match the others at all.  fitted sheets were sown in a circle making it a nightmare to get on the mattress  and the side seams on the flat sheets were all puckered.  I will never buy anything from this company again.  Be fore warned!  They received one star only because it wouldn't take it without that.
title: Do Not waste your money on these sheets

author: Leonard
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 22, 2018
review_content: My wife told me to leave the sheet buying business to her. I wanted to show her that I was quite capable of buying bed sheets. These sheets were used one week after arrival and they receive one cold water washing before usage. I liked how the sheets felt nice, smooth and soft but that was all that I liked about sheets. No problem with the top sheet. The fitted sheet is the one with the discrepancy. The elastic is of poor quality. Some of our older fitting sheets that have had many washings, the elastic still grips the mattress, top and sides. These sheets very flimsy along the sides.  For those of you who would like to know about the corner pockets, they were deep and fit the corners of the mattress perfectly. The elastic although present is nonexistent. A good fitting sheet should hug the mattress totally. If having a bottom sheet that does not fit snugly is not one of your concerns, then this brand of sheets would be fine for you. Some would say you get what you paid for but that should not necessarily be the case. Well, I think  I will stick to buying grass seed and paint and leave  the sheet buying to my wife.
title: IIF IT DOESN'T FIT, YOU HAVE TO ACQUIT.

author: Kadie
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 10, 2017
review_content: Your browser does not support HTML5 video.           The texture of the sheets are very soft and I didn't find any flaws in the fiber once I took them out of the packaging. Definitely worth the price. Would buy again.
title: Quality Sheets

author: megan
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 4, 2017
review_content: This is my first product review on amazon. I just moved to a new apartment and was looking forward to putting new sheets on my bed along with a new comforter. Right out of the box my white fitted sheet had stains in multiple locations. I decided to go ahead and try to wash/bleach the sheet, thinking returning them would be more of a hassle. Unfortunately, the stains did not come out. I'm concerned it's actually mold!? I've contacted mellanni directly and am hoping for a refund or replacement, but just a warning. If even the reviews seem too good to be true, they likely are. At least in my case, I got what I paid for.
title: Stained sheets right out of box

author: Skip Worthington
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 27, 2017
review_content: Not good quality.  The sheets continued to bleed color in the wash thru 3 washings.Also, they were very thin.  Not sure the reported thread count was accurate.
title: Although the price is good, not the best quality.  Very thin, and the color bled in the wash.
verified: Size: California KingColor: Imperial BlueVerified Purchase

author: Heather B.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 11, 2017
review_content: Update: I've now been using this sheet set (in white) for a few months I'm still equally in love with them. No pilling yet, they wash nicely and dry quickly. They're still super soft. I'm definitely sold and have been slowly replacing all the other sheet sets in my house with these._________________________________________________I've been using these sheets for a few weeks now and I can absolutely say that they are my favorite sheets ever. I don't know what unicorn this fabric was harvested from, but it's so incredibly soft. It's already 90 here and I'm not finding them too warm at night. I've washed them and thrown them in the dryer and so far so good on not showing any signs of wear. The other thing I like is that they're pretty deep, so they actually fit well on our memory foam mattress. I can't  believe the price; I really didn't know what I was expecting for that price point but I'm am so shockingly pleased. I'm ordering a second set for my bed and replacing both my sons beds with these sheets.
title: These are *literally* the best sheets ever.

author: The Fair Critic
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 25, 2016
review_content: My wife said all our other sheets were itchy, sooo... I searched on Amazon and found these. Rated a Best Seller in their category these sheets are soft, comfortable sheets. We live in coastal carolina were the humidity is always high and these sheets won't stick to you like other sheets often do. We have only had them for a few weeks, but they seem well made and I hope they last us a long time!The multiple color options was nice as well.Pros1. Color Choice2. Soft, not scratchy3. Well priceUpdate: so we have had these sheets for over a year now and they are definitely our favorite set. The microfiber just seems to get softer with every wash. Much better then our other sheets that we have purchased.Hope this review was helpful, let me know if you have any questions!
title: Soft, Micro-fiber Sheet, Best in Category. Nothing but the best for my wife

author: Michael & Ashley
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 6, 2018
review_content: I've purchased 4 different sets of the Mellanni Bed Sheets (two in different colors in queen size and two of the same color twin-sized). I have also slept on them in the chocolate brown color at my mom's.The reason I think there is some difference in opinion about how soft these sheets are may come down to a couple of reasons...1. It seems that the white sheets are softer than the colored sheets (as I said earlier I have three sets in the white, and one in beige and I have slept on the darker brown sheets in my mom's guest room.) The white sheets are so soft it makes laying on my bed feel like I'm on a silky smooth but cozy pillow. The beige and brown sheets just seem *slightly* scratchier... not quite as soft. Don't get me wrong, they are still softer than most sheets at this price point and still worth using on a guest bed or another bed that's going to get a lot of use, but my husband and I can definitely tell a difference between the white sheets and the other colors.and2. I think what you wash them with and the temperature you use matters. I always use vinegar and wash my sheets with environmentally-friendly laundry detergent (like Charlie's). Depending on the types of stains on the sheets (blood, chocolate), I will usually wash them in cold water because cold water lifts those types of stains. Hot water will set them. If I've spot cleaned them first, then I will wash them on warm warm or warm cold. Washing them in hot water seems to effect how soft they are. And I never line dry because I don't have the space for that. So in the dryer they go.They are thin and don't breathe super great, BUT they are very soft to sleep on. And seriously for the price, I don't even hesitate buying white sheets anymore. I actually just replaced the twin set in my guest room because they *mysteriously* got chocolate milk all over them. They’re too affordable and too soft not to just replace when needed.
title: The colors you buy these in seem to effect how soft they are

author: Lauren Moon
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 12, 2018
review_content: I have NO idea why these sheets have such good reviews. I bought them after seeing a “sponsored” Today Show article. With all the good reviews and only $40, what the heck I figured I would give them a try.Take your money and put it towards ANY OTHER sheet set. I must be a sheet snob or something because these are not soft, comfortable, or worth buying what so ever. They are going in the trash. They are Chinese made and DEFINITELY feel that way. I wish more people would post honest reviews because these are truly the worst sheets we have ever tried. All these 5 star reviews must be from sponsored purchases.
title: JUST DONT!!!!

author: Cinbear86
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 11, 2017
review_content: Wasn't sure who to contact, so posting here as I received email to leave a review.  These sheets had a large stain on them when I took them out of the package.  I do not believe these are brand new sheets.  The package wasn't ziptied together, just zipped in a plastic enclosure.  I would not recommend these on that alone.  I am attaching a picture of the large stain on these supposedly new sheets.
title: Can't possibly be new! Stains on them straight out of the package!

author: Markus
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 2, 2019
review_content: Let me start by saying, I have never purchased anything from Amazon until recently. These sheets were apart of my first purchase. I was REALLY excited to get these and REALLY wanted to like them BUT now that I have them if I could give ZERO stars I would. There is NO WAY these are that high of a thread count. I'd guess 200 at the most! These sheets are THIIIIN! Not thinking about it or "inspecting" them very much first I through them in the washer (because that's what you do with new sheets) O did notice a black mark on the flat sheet but it's towards the bottom where it won't be seen so I wasn't too worried about it. I washed them on cold water and tumble dry at low heat. After they got out I can see that they are already starting to pill. On top of all that they are not true deep pocket sheets. I STRUGGLED to get these on my 15inch mattress and even then they still wouldn't cover the sides. The only "somewhat positive" thing I can say about these are that they are somewhat soft. I will NEVER buy from this company again. Can't return them because I already washed them and I have no other sheets for our new California king mattress so until I get new ones I need them. Total waste of money and MAJOR disappointment. Don't waste your money! I've bought a nice set of microfiber sheets from WALMART that were 100 times better than these and around the same price! In fact I went to Wal-Mart to get the same set but in cal king but they were out of that size at the time. Never again. Spend your money somewhere else!
title: LIES, WASTED MONEY & DISAPPOINTMENT IS ALL YOU'LL GET HERE!
verified: Size: California KingColor: Striped – WhiteVerified Purchase

author: Christian LaRue
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 26, 2018
review_content: I specifically looked for sheets with a good review at a decent price point.  Why these sheets have good reviews I just cant understand it.  They are terrible.  Poor Quality and you can tell just when you pull them out of the packaging.  They feel like laying on plastic wrap.  Its currently winter, we keep our house cool and I wake up sweating on these sheets.  Been using them now 3 months.  Was hoping It was just "me", its not, my husband hates them too.  I guess its time to replace them.  Was hoping after a few washes we would "wear them in" but it hasn't happened....dont buy these, they stink!
title: Not sure why these sheets have such good reviews.

author: Erin Rippy
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 22, 2017
review_content: I've been slowly retiring all the old, mismatched, wrinkled, or scratchy sheets in my linen closet and replacing them with Mellanni sheets.  I have Mellanni sheets on almost every bed in the house, now!  I have sets of Twin, Queen, and King, and the quality is consistent across the board.For my kids beds I have some sets of Pillowfort microfiber sheets from Target that come in fun patterns, which are nice quality as well, but have some Mellanni twin sheets in solid colors for them too.  Although they are close in price, I think the Mellanni twin sheets are a tad softer and better quality than the Pillowfort.  Pillowfort sheets are slick and cool, while Mellanni feel soft and warm.These sheets are resistant to wrinkling, lightweight yet durable, and wash beautifully.  My oldest set is about 2 years old and has been washed countless times, and still looks great.  No pilling, no snags or threadbare areas, no color fading.  I use a free & clear detergent, and MEYERS dryer sheets (plant-based softener and essential oils).  I occasionally add washing soda or borax to loads when washing linens if they need a deep clean.When family or friends stay in our guest room, they often ask me where I got my sheets.  My mother-in-law buys expensive Egyptian Cotton sheets with absurdly high thread counts, and even she asked about my sheets.  She was surprised by how affordable they were for the quality.I have mostly lighter colors, such as white, beige, light gray, spa green (my favorite), and light blue, but I most recently ordered a king set in Royal Blue -- WHICH IS NAVY.  Navy is how it looks in the photos and that's what I wanted, so I'm happy about that.  I also ordered an extra set of pillowcases in Navy (standard, not kind), and the pillowcases are just a slightly different shade of Navy.  I've ordered extra pillowcases in most of the colors I own and this is the only color where there has been any difference.  It's not different enough that I wont put them on the bed with the pillowcases that came with the sheet set.  Most people probably wouldn't notice.
title: Super soft, lightweight but durable, wash up beautifully.

author: K. Durivage
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 10, 2018
review_content: Friends, these sheets are nice and comfy, you don't need me to tell you that. Let me tell you about one life changing feature these sheets have: they are striped, and the stripes always go from the head to the foot of the bed. I've been struggling with fitted bedsheets my entire life, getting them mostly on before realizing I need to take it all off to rotate it 90 degrees. No more. It's a solved problem. I can't promise that I will always buy these striped sheets, but in general I will either need striped sheets, or hired help to do this task for me, and I know which one is cheaper.
title: Stripes prevent fitted sheet confusion!
verified: Size: QueenColor: Striped – Gray / SilverVerified Purchase

author: Terri Grigsby
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 24, 2017
review_content: UPDATE:  Mellanni got back with me regarding my defective sheets.  They offered to send me a replacement set and it is perfect!  Great customer service and very nice sheets that are so soft and comfortable.I am disappointed in the quality of these sheets.  After washing them in cold water before using them I put them on the bed.  I noticed right away a white stripe at the bottom of the fitted sheet.  So I thought well okay, that won't show.  So then I put the top sheet on and there was a noticeable defect of white stripes all across the sheet.  These are blue sheets with mile blue stripes on them (like in the advertised photo).  However, the white stripes are clearly a defect.  I have already washed them so I can't send them back.  They feel soft, but I haven't slept on them yet.  I don't buy new sheets very often, so I was disappointed that these were defective.  I have attached photos so you can see what I'm talking about.  Also, since this didn't include 2 extra pillowcases, I had to buy those and they cost about half as much as the whole 4 piece sheet set!
title: Beautiful, comfortable sheets!
verified: Size: QueenColor: Striped – Light BlueVerified Purchase

author: Bryan C. Bacher
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 17, 2018
review_content: UPDATE 2:  I received the replacement sheets and in excellent condition.  I have washed them and, as noted in other reviews, they are very soft. They are also thin and they are a little warmer than cotton sheets, but I expected this anyway from other reviews.  However, the customer service was outstanding and, as some others have noted in their reviews, I expect these sheets will hold up longer than other sheets I have purchased in this price range.************************************************************************************************************************************************************UPDATE:  The seller emailed me minutes after I posted this review and asked if I am willing to try another set.  They stated that this was an unfortunate defect but not an exemplar of their product.  I agreed and I will update this review after I have received the replacement.***********************************************************************************************************************************************************The sheets I purchased had stitching missing, had a dime-sized hole in the fitted sheet, had dark stains on the pillow cases, and the pillow cases are too small for my standard sized pillows.  I am not sure how an item can be so much of a disaster when there are tens of thousands of reviews and 75% of them are 5 star.  One thing that I thought was amusing given all of the other problems with these sheets...the product tag on the flat sheet is sewn into the top hem.  I guess this is for emergency reading material when I forget to bring a book to bed.
title: The sheets I purchased had stitching missing, had a ...

author: Blues 'n BBQ
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 30, 2018
review_content: These sheets are by far the best value out there. We've gone through several sets of sheets trying to find that balance of comfort, durability and price. Sad to say that sheet sets 3x the price of these have torn in a relatively short amount of time. Remember when you were a kid and had the same sets of cotton sheets your whole childhood? A $100 set (last sheets purchased) shouldn't fail in a year, or 2 even. (And we're not doing an unusual gymnastic moves in our bed either..)These sheets are very comfortable and the price is certainly right. Not THE most luxurious sheets I've ever slept on, but more than just "acceptable". They're not hot, not sticky feeling, they don't end up in a ball at the foot of the bed in the morning, and best of all the fitted bottom sheet stays put ! I highly recommend these sheets. I bought 1 set and liked them enough to buy 2 more sets.
title: Best value in sheets out there.

author: Jackie Roberts
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 6, 2017
review_content: I purchased these sheets for my Beautyrest BlackIce Hybrid bed, which is a 15.5 inch mattress. I am sad to say that even though the description says "DEEP POCKET", these barely  go down, and I have to use those stupid straps. When I looked at the tag when I was applying the stupid straps? The dimensions said it was only 14 inches deep.  That being said, these are very soft, and they were a pleasure to sleep on, and I DID NOT have any pilling problems with them. I am sad to have to contact customer service.to see about a refund.  They may work for you if you dont have a super duper thick mattress, with extra stuff on it, like an additional memory foam on top, with a mattress pad, etc. I gave the 1 star because I bought them for the 16 " deep pocket, in the description, and they weren't, so now I have to buy new sheets, and go thru all the hassle all over again. I hate deceptiveness.
title: NOT DEEP POCKET... wont cover a 15" mattress
verified: Size: Split King SetColor: BeigeVerified Purchase

author: Jive in the [415]
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 4, 2018
review_content: I needed new sheets. After seeing the overwhelming number of positive reviews, I bought them.I'm extremely disappointed with these sheets. After receiving my order, these sheets reaffirm my belief that buying 100% cotton sheets are the only way to go. The "microfiber" sheets are 100% synthetic (polyester) and very thin. They are so thin they feel like gauze. The pillowcases have a decorative stripe on ONE SIDE of the pillowcase, and nothing on the opposite side. The flat sheet has a decorative stripe on ONE SIDE, and nothing on the other side. They look unfinished because they are unfinished, and they clearly cut corners to reduce the cost of manufacturing.Whether we spend twenty dollars or one hundred bucks on sheets and pillowcases, we want them to be attractive. Unfinished and cheaply made look exactly like that. You get what you pay for. One hundred percent cotton sheets they are not, and they're not even a close approximation. I do not recommend buying these sheets.
title: These sheets are cheaply made, overhyped, and a huge disappointment.

author: Bookworm
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 27, 2018
review_content: If you are concerned about the positive reviews being fake based on the sheer number of them, rest easy (preferably on these sheets) and don't hesitate to buy. I purchased two queen sets based on the reviews and am very satisfied that the positive reviews here are legit. I am no stranger to excellent quality sheets, and I currently own three sets of the highest quality Egyptian cotton sheets that I purchased for more than $300 per set. I won't go as far as to say that these are as good as the Egyptian cotton, but they are very close to the comfort and softness especially when you consider that you could buy twelve sets of these for the cost of one of my expensive sets. I don't think I could add anything new to my review that hasn't already been said many times over. My fiance and her little girl think these are great and since purchasing, my $300 sheets have not made their way back on the bed. Both prefer these to the Egyptian cotton sheets, but I can't honestly say that I do.  If someone asked me what this sheet set cost without knowing, I'd have guessed at least $100.I subtracted one star because the white set had black marks on both of the pillowcases that will not wash out. I do not doubt that the company would replace them if asked. However, it doesn't seem worth the hassle of repacking and taking them to the post office, so I simply flip the pillows with the marked side down and ignore it.These are great sheets and I cannot imagine that you will be disappointed with them.
title: Almost Perfect

author: FrecklesRLuv
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 28, 2018
review_content: I was very excited when I saw the reviews for these sheets on the Today Show. As I was looking for quality sheets at an affordable price, these sounded perfect. Unfortunately, it was too good to be true. The sheets came without any issues (I didn’t have any tears or fitting issues) and washed the before putting them on the bed. The first night felt like a dream. The sheets were so soft and silky that I knew I would be ordering several more. But by the third day, the sheets began to create little lent balls (pilling like a bad sweater). It was so annoying because it felt like there was something in the bed rubbing against my legs. The softness is gone and the sheets already pulled off. I gave one star for the design as the paisley print was beautiful. Too bad the actual use of them was poor. What a waste of money.
title: Too good to be true!

author: Lulu Cripe
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 12, 2018
review_content: Every fitted sheet, regardless of manufacturer, has an elastic band sewn into a channel along the sheet's edge. Every fitted sheet that I have ever handled has that elastic band secured in its channel so that the sheet does not bunch up on the elastic band at any particular point along its edge. Every fitted sheet, except this one. The elastic band in this one was free floating and the sheet would bunch up on the band as it was fitted on the mattress. However, that was not the worst part. While stretching the sheet to fit it to the mattress for the first time, the elastic band broke. The fact that the elastic band was free floating in its channel no doubt contributed to its breaking. As a result, the fitted sheet will not hug the mattress. Extremely disappointed in this product. Ditched intention to purchase more if it felt comfortable.
title: that was not the worst part. While stretching the sheet to fit it ...

author: Jordan Deal
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 1, 2017
review_content: I do love the feel of these sheets, but I wish it would have lasted even one time on my bed. I have a full size bed and I bought the full size set, but it didn’t seem to quite fit my bed.I have a little bit of extra height because of the gel top part of the mattress and sheets tend to fit snuggly to my bed. I put the sheet on and it was a really tight fit. Then I heard a rip sound and one of the corners started to rip until it stopped at where the sewn pieces meet.I doubt this will last a single wash before it gets destroyed. I know nothing about types of cloth and I don’t know if it was my fault for buying 100% polyester sheets or these sheets were slightly too small for a full size bed.
title: Ripped right after putting it on.

author: Jade Ring
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 27, 2017
review_content: I bought the coral colored queen size set.  I had never bought microfiber bedsheets before and was worried I wouldn't like the material.  I was also worried I wouldn't like the coral color.  But I needn't have worried on either count.  The coral color is pretty and not too orange-y.  The material is very soft and feels amazingly like thin cotton bedsheets from my childhood in the 70's only softer.  I understand what people are talking about when they say it may not be breathable but I didn't have a problem with that.Won't bother going into detail but customer service was excellent when I thought there was a problem.  Great communication.  Highly recommend trying out microfiber through Mellanni because if you are dissatisfied with their product, they will try to make it right.P.S. It's gone through the wash just fine.  Will update if that changes in future washings.
title: Super soft!

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 21, 2018
review_content: After about a month, I have not heard from the seller regarding this issue. Out of curiosity, I read other 1-Star reviews and see similar customer reviews but with no feedback from the seller. It appears that the customer views it’s customers as one large revenue opportunity rather than viewing its customers as individuals. I would suggest supporting a different business that cares about a customer’s satisfaction and experience.These sheets were thinner than I was expecting, but I didn't find this a serious issue and was happy to keep the product. Unfortunately after 3 days of normal use, a two-inch section of a seam on my pillowcase has opened up. It looks like a large section of the pillowcase was not sewn properly to begin with. This is pretty disappointing given the positive reviews I read from other customers. I will need to purchase a replacement soon given that this seam will continue to open.
title: Improperly Sewn Pillowcase

author: C.M. Hicks
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 22, 2018
review_content: I purchased this set of striped sheets after being very pleased with the purple Mellanni king sheet set, and a set of solid color twin bed sheets. However, there was a big difference between the striped and solid sheets. The striped sheets hold large and small wrinkles that make the bed unattractive and uncomfortable. While the solid colors are virtually wrinkle free. Mellanni customer service contacted me via email asking if I was satisfied with my purchase. I replied with the above complaint. Mellanni customer service emailed a reply and offered to send me another sheet set of my choice and apologized for the inconvenience. I am very impressed that a company offers to replace sheets without me ever making a complaint or writing a review. I was just going to keep the striped sheets and make the best of it. I can't recommend the striped sheets, I don't know if any other striped set has the same problem. I highly recommend the solid sheets and buying from this company. The Mellanni sheets that I have are nicer than my 1200 CT Egyptian cotton sheets. They look good, are cool to sleep on, take up very little shelf room once folded, wash and dry quickly. If you are not satisfied, this is a company that stands behind their products and obviously cares about customers. Can't ask for more than that.
title: Outstanding customer service, good price, nice sheets!
verified: Size: KingColor: Striped – Gray / SilverVerified Purchase

author: Brandon
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 31, 2018
review_content: There is no denying that these sheets are incredibly soft and they feel absolutely fantastic to sleep on and under.  Since they come in dozens of colors I had not problem picking something that would match the look of the comfortable and feel of the bedroom.My issue, and I read others had this as well, is a look of a grease or oil stains.  First thing I did when I got them was run them through the washing machine on a gentle cold cycle.  After I put on the fitted sheet I immediately noticed a couple of what I thought may have just been water marks that didn't dry properly, but after a few hours (and days and weeks) they never went away.  After sleeping on them for a couple of months there is a very apparent dark spot in the shape of my back that won't wash out either.  I'm not a particular sweaty guy nor would I be considered to have over active oil glands plus I wash my sheets once a week so really those stains shouldn't be there.Although all that is hidden under the comforter it's still frustrating to have stains on the sheets. For that, they get marked down but the softness really helps drive the three star rating - the sheets are magical when it comes to the feel.Last thought, the sheets feel pretty thin.  So far they've held up just fine with a few months of use and washes but it's certainly a possibility they could degrade sooner then some other sets of sheets I've owned.
title: Magical Feeling Sheets That May Stain Easily
verified: Size: QueenColor: Striped – Gray / SilverVerified Purchase

author: Grzesiu
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 13, 2018
review_content: I went back and forth weighing my options, and reading all the reviews before I decided on these sheets.  Yes, they are a great price, but the material is so thin!  And the pillow case flap that others have mentioned sort of just hangs out.  I am not sending them back just because of the hassle, and will keep this set as an extra one when in a pinch, or just give them to someone in need.  Just not the quality I hope they would be.  I know they have a lot of great reviews, but I have an airbnb and would prefer something else.  I will look for ones that have a cotton blend rather than 100% polyester.Update:  8/29/18  I have washed the sheets and they have become softer, so I decided to up my rating.  I think the issue is more whether you like polyester or not.  I found that I do not like 100% polyester.  I like the feel of cotton much better and will have to learn to deal with the wrinkles that come with it.  I just wish I could fine more sheet sets that are a blend of the 2 materials.  Having said that, I must say that I am impressed with the customer service for this company.  They honestly wanted me to be satisfied and went to lengths to accomplish that.I respect that in a company.  They are sending out cotton sheets!  :)
title: Super thin material

author: Michael Spindler
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 22, 2019
review_content: Spend the money on natural cotton with a 1000+ thread count.  It will last for years and you won't be sleeping in a toxic soup that adds fumes to your home.  Petroleum mining makes the microfiber sheets spread harmful chemicals into homes, through contact or through fumes that may be emitted over time. This can cause pollution in the buildings’ indoor air quality.I don't why I bought this set.  I did not look into the material first and after examining them, I am not going to spend my time ironing sheets.  Returned.
title: If you don't mind sleeping in petroleum waste products - This is for you!

author: Debra F
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 24, 2018
review_content: The reviews on these sheets sounded wonderful, so I was looking forward to buying them.  I purchased a set of the split-king.  They are as comfortable as everyone claimed, but I have had three small issues with them - which is why I am giving a 3 star rating instead of a 5 star.  1) Upon opening the package I found that two of the corners on one of the fitted sheets had split threads, with the edges trailing out.  Not a big deal, but did require some minimal sewing to repair so that the entire stitch didn't come undone.  Someone that should not happen until it is used for a long time, not when when you just opened a new product.  2) In the first wash, even though I used cold/cold water, a little of the blue dye ran and slightly stained three other items in the wash with it.  3) While the fitted sheets slide over the bed well, during the night, the corners come up and if you don't fix it each day, on the second night at least one will pop off.  So yes, I did find them very comfortable and I liked the vibrant color, but the quality was not what I was expecting.
title: Very comfortable, but slides off the corners of the bed.
verified: Size: Split King SetColor: Imperial BlueVerified Purchase

author: Suthrn Angel
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 27, 2018
review_content: I have only had these sheets 12 days and when I went to pull the corners back over the each corner, my hand went straight through the material! It wasn't on a seam, it was the material itself!My husband just died suddenly so I am on a fixed income. I bought these sheets because the other reviews seemed to give the sheet set decent reviews. I do not have the money to go buy more sheets and now I am stuck with these garbage sheets because I washed them before I put them on my bed. The factories these are produced in are dirty and I wash all new sheets before using them.Buyer Beware...these feel soft and comfy upon arrival but they are thin and basically junk.Don't waste your money!
title: Poorest Quality Sheets I Ever Owned!

author: Linda L. Ashton
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 4, 2019
review_content: I purchased this item and held back putting the sheets on my bed for a special occasion and with the holidays I decided now was a great time. So excited to make my bed so pretty looking........as I pulled the fitted sheet to put on edge it was like the elastic was old and dry as it broke and I heard it snap as I pull to put on the edge. I was extremely disappointed but they are on the bed as I wanted something special for the holidays. I am 72 years old so I am sure I didn't pull it too hard as I just don't have that much strength. They looked beautiful but they are  not made well. Thought important I share my experience.
title: Not made well

author: Andy
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 17, 2019
review_content: Umm am I missing something? Why do people like these so much?? I was so excited to try them out because of the insane amount of great reviews and blogger recs for these. I took them out of the package and was instantly disappointed. Decided I needed to give them a fair shot so I continued to make the bed and get into it. I actually hate them. I agree with the review that says if you already have nice sheets that you’ll hate these. It’s 10:30pm and I’m probably going to strip the bed and remake it with our normal sheets (threshold ultra soft ones from target. They’re incredible!) These do not even come close.. they feel cheap AF. I believe someone mentioned it’s like sleeping between two shower curtains? I’d say that’s pretty accurate. I don’t feel like fighting to get them back in the package and return them so I’ll keep as a back up for emergency cases only. Really, they’re just not good at all. Also, the pillow cases smell really chemically. 1/10 would NOT recommend. Not even worth the cheap price tag
title: No. Just, no.

author: Denver in Divide
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 23, 2017
review_content: My wife loves these sheets.  They are soft, but they are a little warm for my taste.  Being microfiber they do shed a little the 1st couple of washings.  The fitted sheets have deep pockets and work well with a very thick double sided quilted mattress.  They have elastic all the way around and stay in place, also don't have to fight with them to get them on the mattress.  I have purchased a couple of sets now.  They are well worth the price if you like microfiber sheets.The 1800 is just misleading it has nothing to do with thread count as this are not cotton.  As another reviewer put it "if you like crisp sheets" these are not for you.  I still prefer a real high thread count cotton sheet, but they are soft and wife loves them.
title: My wife loves these sheets

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 20, 2019
review_content: How do almost 50k people think these are acceptable linens? This is cheap polyester. If you are looking for sheers to cover your windows-this is what you have. The pillowcases have the detailing, yet the top sheet does not. The stitching eveeywhere is crap, the whole thing is crap.I guess people don't care about quality linens anymore. I do. I don't want see-through sheets or pillowcases.  Polyester-no matter how fancy they make it sound is still polyester-a synthetic fiber that will not breathe.The pillowcases seem to have the envelope feature, however, the envelope is not large enough to stay on the pillow when you sleep-the whole point of the feature!I would rather have wrinkled cotton, breathable linens than this. Don't fall for the high reviews if you have any quality standards. Polyester is polyester weather its called "brushed" or "luxury"...A waste of time. I can't wait to send it back and forget all about this experience. The next time I read an article online about "best items on Amazon", I'm going to laugh and close the internet window.
title: Horrible!

author: Sophie D
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 22, 2019
review_content: I bought these bed sheets because of the numerous five star reviews. I picked red, to go with the comforter set I also purchased. This is a brand new house my husband and I just moved in. We used the sheets for a couple of nights. I have now noticed that the wall behind the bed has turned red, because of the dye in the sheets. I tried to clean it but it seems to be permanent, it will not go away. I am beyond upset at these cheap, poor quality products. How is that even possible??? Who are the people who left good reviews? Are they blind? Or am I the only one to buy colored sheets? I will never buy this brand again. An update: since I bought these sheets, small particles of lint are everywhere. When I dust the furniture, the dust collected is red. The ceiling fan has bright red dust on it. I can only imagine the amount of small red particles that we inhaled while using these sheets. Not to mention that the sheets started to tear up after two washes.
title: Permanently stained the wall

author: Colorado Pat
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 21, 2017
review_content: I didn't think sheets could be made so cheaply.  1/4 inch seam around the outside that looks like it will pull apart with the first wash.  I am surprised because of all the good reviews -- don't waste your money -- I will never again buy a sheet that I can't touch first, and examine the way it is made.  Bottom sheet does not fit my king sized bed cleanly -- what a waste of money...
title: SAVE YOUR MONEY !!!

author: Traveler
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 20, 2017
review_content: I'm changing my rating to two stars.  I had 5 stars before. The sheets are soft, but they absorb body oils.  My husband has oily hair and there's always a a big dark circle on his pillow case.  It gets continually worse as the week goes on.  It launders out but then the cycle starts all over again.  Never seen this with any other sheets.  I'm giving up on these and going back to high thread cotton.I have to add my name to the long list of positive reviews.  I love these sheets!  They are so soft, not hot (which was really important to me!) and launder nicely.  I never would have bought these without a recommendation from a friend.  I always looked for high thread count cotton.  But, I am sold!  I bought the gray stripe.  I like stripes because it is easy for me to figure out which way to put on the bottom fitted sheet.
title: update Sept 2018
verified: Size: QueenColor: Striped – Gray / SilverVerified Purchase

author: Steven Hosepi
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 3, 2018
review_content: You get what you pay for.  These sheets are poorly cut and do not lay well.  The pillow cases are too short to fit a regular sized pillow and still close at the end so that you don't actually see the pillow.  The top sheet is cut way, way larger than the fitted sheet - larger than any queen size sheet I've ever used.  The sheets are extremely thin, so thin that you can see through them, and they are hot.Garbage.  Would not buy again.
title: Super cheap, pooly made

author: TheDaliLova
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 26, 2018
review_content: UPDATE:The seller representative (Mia) contacted me after I requested a replacement/return.  They offered to send a replacement ASAP.  She was professional, courteous and prompt in responses.  It arrived within 4 days and was in perfect condition.  I still have concerns about the thinness of the fabric but it appears per my reading about "microfiber" that this is a pretty normal quality of microfiber.  It is supposed to be a durable product in spite of if it being thin.  Time will tell.  I encourage all buyers to read more about "microfiber sheets" online prior to purchasing just so you can see the pros and cons and how to care for them to ensure their longevity.  It's nice to see that this company backs their product, cares that the customer is pleased with it and doesn't disappear after the initial sale is complete.INITIAL REVIEW:I sniffed around for the best reviewed DARK GRAY (i.e. charcoal) microfiber bed sheets and although it wasn't clear cut, I ended up purchasing these.  Only time will tell if I made the right choice overall.Upon receipt, I did a brief visual inspection to look for stains.  It was one of the complaints from some reviewers so I thought I should take a cursory look.  I only noticed one or two modest stains (oily by appearance) which left me confused.  Was someone in their manufacturing plant eating an oily Italian cold cuts sandie while producing or inspecting these sheets?  How in the __ do brand new sheets end up with oily or greasy looking stains?  Way to go inspector #147 who apparently decided NOT to take a lunch in the break room.Regardless, I'm not packing these up and dealing with the hassle if I can try and get them out myself.  Needless to say, that likely wasn't the right call since after washing (exactly in the manner they instructed) I now realize there were about 4 oily looking stains which are still visible after drying them on LOW (per their instructions).  I am a visual flaw-oriented person so this does bother me since I bought a NEW product, not a used one.  Hopefully when the wife gets back in town, she won't notice or care and I can learn to live with this since it's rarely going to be seen by human eyes.Another con is the material DURABILITY which I can see why other reviewers have stated that these sheets ripped within 2 years.  This material is very SOFT and FANTASTIC to sleep on.  Unfortunately, this material is also very THIN and I would strongly recommend using "kid gloves" when placing these on your mattress.  If you yank it hard onto a corner, I could easily see you increasing the likelihood of a rip or tear.Another con is the FIT.  The corners are loose and baggy compared with the pretty good quality 100% cotton sheets we were using prior to these.  Our cotton sheets fit nice and taut on the corners hugging them well whereas these appear baggy and loose and not form-fitting.  Our old sheets were KING (not CalKing) and these are KING, so I'm not sure if it is a size difference or material issue.The color is a true DARK GRAY and very pure gray.  There isn't any blue or silver hue to it at all.  The stitching is good, not great.  I saw some loose thread inside but I believe it was extra thread and not pertinent stitching to the integrity of the sheets.These are definitely warmer than our old cotton sheets which is nice since we have a condo with very high ceilings and it gets cold in the winter.  In Southern California, builders barely use insulation so oddly enough sound and cold penetrate more than you would think.  Additionally, you won't confuse these with flannel sheets for warmth and I feel that they'll still work during our summers since we're fairly close to the ocean.The two best things about these sheets are the REASONABLE PRICE and the SOFTNESS.  The worst things are the questionable durability, the fit and the manufacturing quality control (i.e. oily potato chips or deli meat stains).
title: "The Big Unknown"...

author: S. Meads
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 17, 2017
review_content: So far so good.  I ordered 2 sets.  They are soft and good quality... Can't beat the price!Update:  When I wrote this had washed both sets, but only used one.  When changing out to the second set I noticed the flat sheet was different from the first.  The flat sheet on the first set felt just like the fitted sheet, a brushed microfiber, but the flat sheet on the second set has a satin type on the underside which retains the heat something terrible!!  The first set great, cool, comfortable, and as described, the second set was different from the first so I will be returning that one.
title: Five Stars

author: Jeana Kim
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 19, 2017
review_content: Listen, everyone ! This is the best sheets ever. My kids have heavy allergies and were itching all the time. I purchased this after reading that the sheets were hypoallergenic and cool sheets. I thought maybe this might only be an advertisement but when I bought the item and used it for a week now. I am completely satisfied. Please buy this if your kids sleep under high body temperature conditions. This is a very good quality product.
title: Very Happy and Great Quality. I highly recommend.
verified: Size: Twin XLColor: Light GrayVerified Purchase

author: Skyrod74
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 9, 2017
review_content: Not what I was expecting! Sheets are very well priced. But I did not realize they are 100% polyester and are fairly thin. The sheets, while very soft, do retain a great deal of moisture and cause me to sweat like crazy. The sheets seem to wash well and retain their color, but have a great deal of static out of the dryer. While I'm not happy with this purchase, I've decided to keep as a emergency backup. These sheets may work well for most, however I now know there is nothing better than 100% prima cotton in my opinion.
title: do retain a great deal of moisture and cause me to sweat like ...

author: Jennifer Hyde
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 26, 2019
review_content: I purchased these after a bunch of rave reviews. I needed an extra pair of sheets, and loved the print. Unfortunately these were a big miss. They are the cheapest quality fabric I have ever felt. I couldn't imagine sleeping on them all night, as they were stiff to the touch. The seams already had some fraying and overall the quality felt poor. Obviously, you get what you pay for, but I can get a set of sheets from a big box retailer (the one with the red circle), for relatively the same cost that are better quality. I am still in search for great linens on Amazon!
title: Poor fabric and quality

author: Amy Beth Luthor
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 23, 2019
review_content: Forget that these are microfiber. Forget that these are under $30. These really are the BEST sheets ever! I purchased the light pink and they are absolutely gorgeous! They are the softest and most comfortable sheets I've ever had! The customer service is outstanding. I did receive a set with some random areas of darker pink dye. I contacted them and they apologized and offered me either a full refund or a new set. Of course I chose the new set, as I said, these are the best sheets ever. AND...I get to keep the first set of sheets! They are not see-through either. They are not hot. They are wrinkle free and deep pocket with elastic all around. No other fitted sheets would stay on my bed! These are the only sheets I will ever buy. This is not a fake review! I am a real person. That is why I included a picture of my personal dog when this is a review about sheets. I know- doesn't make sense. That's why I did it. Cuz I'm real. Besides, she's besut :) Buy the sheets!
title: Best sheets EVER!!!

author: Ryan Elizabeth
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 16, 2017
review_content: I’m so disappointed and irritated with this order. Not only does this set NOT  have the stitching shown in the photos but they sent me a CAL king flat sheet with a queen-size fitted sheet. I ordered a king! I don’t know what happened but this order got all messed up.  Irritated... hopefully you have better luck than I do!I thought for sure based on the reviews that this would be a good purchase but I was 100% WRONG! :(
title: Sheets do not have the stitching shown in photos nor did they send me the right sizes

author: Jessica Baugnet
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 18, 2020
review_content: I am not sure yet on all the items listed. What I bought the sheets for was the deep pockets. 21" is great. I have a pillow top queen mattress,  with mattress pad, with a 2" cooling mattress topper.I have been fighting with pulling down sheets. So far putting them on, seems like a great fit. I will follow up if they disappoint,  but yay for another great product.Not paid for any comments left on here. Still just a broke person, helping others!
title: Just got sheets
verified: Size: EXTRA DEEP pocket - QueenColor: Spa BlueVerified Purchase

author: MK
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 4, 2019
review_content: I do not know how this product received so many high reviews.I bought two sets and they both are low quality. If you don't mind thin material that pills up right out of the bag, then you found it!I can't even stand to feel the material. It's similar  to nails on on chalkboard. It's irritating. I'm using them as a cushion meaning I have a cover on top of them.My old sheets that are ripped are better than this....If I could give it a zero, I would.
title: Low Quality
verified: Size: California KingColor: Striped – Gray / SilverVerified Purchase

author: Marian Bostwick
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 18, 2019
review_content: These sheets are absolute garbage. First, they aren't cut properly, so they're literally impossible to fold. No matter how they're washed, with Downy, or dried with Bounce, or line dried, they stick to everything, including themselves. They stick to the bed, the box spring, the blankets, and me. I get static electricity just from handling them and shock my Kitty! They won't lay flat. I've been folding sheets for 60 years. I finally rolled them in a ball and stuffed them down in the edge of my Cedar Chest. I might use them to tie up something I need to put in the rafters. They certainly won't be on my bed. And, I washed them several times thinking the problem was whatever they were treated with.They are so thin you can see though them.  In my educated, experienced opinion, don't waste your money. I have flannel sheets that are 30 or more years old. No kidding. I used them for 5 kids, took the sheets camping, used them on the beds, washed & dried and line dried them countless times. Good thing I saved all those my Mom, her Mom and my M-I-Law bought me through the years. They are in perfect shape, better than any new sheets I've seen in 15 years. I have one on my bed now. Real flannel. No fraying. When washed they smell clean after all these years. No piling. I wish I could still find that kind of quality.
title: I'm trying to figure what to use these for

author: Grandmapink
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 21, 2019
review_content: So disappointed.  Really wanted to like these sheets as there were so many good reviews.  We got the split king  for our new memory foam adjustable bed. Upon receipt today, we took the sheets out of the package and washed them per instructions.  When we went to put them on the bed, there were 2 stains, one on one of the twin XL bottom sheets, and one on the king top sheet.  The stains are gross and not something you would expect from brand new sheets that have never been slept on.  In reading more reviews, I see others complained about the stains too.  You get what you pay for, I guess.  Update:  Ripped first night!!  Woke up to find a huge hole in the sheet!  WORST SHEETS I Have ever purchased! Minus zero stars!
title: STAINED RIGHT OUT OF PACKAGE - Have ever purchased! Ripped first night! DON'T BUY!
verified: Size: Split King SetColor: GrayVerified Purchase

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 16, 2018
review_content: The sheets were purchased for my daughter in CA. While the quality is excellent, when she removed them from the package, the flat king size sheet was stained brown in a few areas as well as the pillow cases. She washed them,however, the stains remained. Since the color is cream, she wasn’t able to use any stain remover, just detergent. For $30.00, this is unacceptable and I will be contacting the seller and Amazon. I also purchased the same sheets in blue. I am very disappointed and upset that this product was defective and am requesting a refund or replacement.
title: Fabric is excellent, but sheets were stained and couldn’t be removed with detergent! Unacceptable!

author: PF
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 10, 2019
review_content: Our last set of sheets cost $199.  When the bottom sheets shredded simultaneously after 3+ years of (constant) use, we decided to get these until we researched an alternative.  After having these for one week, I've decided they ARE the alternative!  We have a split king adjustable bed with a 12" natural latex mattress.  The fitted sheets stay in place perfectly, the top sheet is nice and large, and they have a really nice feel - not cold like sateen, not fuzzy like flannel, not rough like some cottons - just nice.  The gray is also a very pretty color.  On first inspection, they seemed a bit thin, but now I think that might better be described as lightweight and a good thing.  In any case, at this price, they only have to last 6 months to beat the cost per month of our last set for something just as comfortable!  :)
title: Pleasantly Surprised!
verified: Size: Split King SetColor: GrayVerified Purchase

author: Mollie Williams
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 8, 2019
review_content: These sheets are a mess.  They have a very loose elastic that runs through the whole sheet which does not keep the sheets in place.  In other words, a rumpled mess.  The sheets are also very warm which is very typical of microfiber sheets.  Before bed each night I found myself pulling the sheets from one side to straighten them out. Top sheet creeps to one side also.  My second set of microfiber sheets, never again.
title: Worst ever

author: Sonja33
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 23, 2017
review_content: I am in LOVE with these sheets! The colors pop and don't fade, they are also true to the display pictures. I opened the package and got really excited because they felt to good, then after the first wash, they came out softer! It's not too thin and it's not silky. It's perfect for the summer (stays dry and cool) and i will be trying these in the winter for sure! Thabk you so much! I will definitely be buying more colors :)
title: PLEASE BUY THESE!

author: James P.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 24, 2018
review_content: I did days of research on sheets, and found these rated highly on several sites. The reviews on here were also good. So, I purchased these, even though the price point made me wary. I should have trusted my gut. These are too good to be true.  The fabric is super thin and feels cheap, rather than "luxurious". Additionally, the fitted sheet was super loose and had at least 3 inches of bunched up fabric on the sides of our mattress, even though our mattress is a 14" pillow top queen. We are returning these, and will spend more on a better product.
title: Don't Believe the Hype

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 2, 2020
review_content: I am thoroughly confused as to how in the name of gd these have so many good reviews. You guys must have just opened them and felt them because if you have ever slept under these sheets, there is NO way you are loving them. I washed these and put them on my bed right away. I have been sleeping on them for the past five nights. I was seriously ready to call my doctor about a sudden onset of extreme night sweats when I remembered that I had just put on these new sheets. I have NEVER sweat that much in my entire life! I mean head to toe, out of every single pore. The only plus I can think of about these is that they are great for weight loss. No joke though, I have not sweat so much in my life, not even after the most vigorous workouts and tedious ten mile runs.
title: Worst Purchase I Have EVER Made On Amazon

author: BRKLYN
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 6, 2019
review_content: Yes, they are pretty good for the price point. Yes, they are quite soft and yes, they are very thin. All things mentioned by other reviewers.I didn’t expect thick hotel quality sheets for this price so I don’t mind the thinness. But I was pleasantly surprised at how soft they were. But I don’t think these will last a year in regular rotation being they are so thin. But it’ll be great in the summer.My main issue is the static cling and the pilling after just a couple of washes. I have long dark hair and after a wash/dry, there was a bunch of hair stuck to the sheets. This doesn’t happen with my other sheet sets. And for this reason I probably wouldn’t buy another set.
title: Good for the cost but subpar quality.

author: Tommy Cooney
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 3, 2020
review_content: This sheet set is one of the cheapest, least desirable sheets I have ever laid eyes on and actually laid on. I got a the orange color and while they are orange, they are a strange shade of orange and seems like the color goes with nothing.These are polyester and feel like it. They are hot to sleep on and look like these would not hold up very well.I will be donating this to set to a local charity.. Some people seem to like this type of fabric but I should have stuck with cotton percale.Pros - price (but you get what you pay for), wrinkle resistent (because it's plastic)Cons - cheap material (even for polyester)The orange color is really off putting. If anyone else got the orange, did you find the color odd?These sleep hot. If you are a hot sleeper, stay away from these sheets.Lastly, the fabric does not allow you to easily move along it if you have sleepwear on. It seems like you get stuck on the fabric.
title: Very cheap material that sleeps hot.

author: B. Moore
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 10, 2015
review_content: I was excited about these sheets for our new king bed. The color is nice and they feel soft.  While the sheets feel comfortable they are very thin and the elastic around the fitted sheet was literally showing through when I took them out of the package. The sheet was not sewn together properly and the fitted sheet is ripped and the white elastic can be seen.  I chalk this up to the old adage you get what you pay for.  I won't purchase these again because I don't know honestly how they will hold up.  I regret not spending a little more and getting something that will last.
title: Disappointed

author: ajk170
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 15, 2017
review_content: I love this sheet set!  We bought the king set in tan and the length of the flat sheet is great on our 16" mattress.  The sides come down to the top of the bed's side rails and the bottom allows us to tuck under the mattress and put hospital corners on it with no problem leaving about 6 inches fro, the top of the mattress.  The flat sheet isn't so long that you can fold the top back onto itself.  Maybe if you have a thinner mattress, but tucking it at the bottom on a 16" mattress down't leave enough of the sheet to fold back at the top of the mattress. So if that's the look you want and have thick pillow-top mattresses, this will disappoint you.  These are rather light weight (good for hot climates) and super soft(soft is somewhat relative- but soft too me). I agree with the other reviews that they may stain easier than other sheets so oils and lotions maybe a problem.  The other odd point to note, the top of the sheet does not have a nice piping to denote the top that mimics the piping on the pillow cases (as seen in the picture).  The king pillows easily fit our king pillows.  The fitted sheet appears to have elastic all the way around, not just the top and bottom where the corners are so if that bothers you, then these aren't for you.Overall, for the money (we sent $42) these are great sheets.  I thought to give it four stars since it lacks the detail on the flat sheet (ie the piping at the top of the sheet that is found on almost all flat sheets).  but that would be unfair since you can't see it and it doesn't detract from the feel or how it functions.
title: I love this sheet set

author: Olivia
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 12, 2018
review_content: This is the 2nd set of these sheets I have ordered. The first set was the burgundy color and I have had them 4 years and still are in all right shape. This will seam obvious but if you put the fitted sheet on the raw mattress it will pop off constantly once I got a mattress cover I didn’t have that issue.
