The sheets are very soft and the color holds up (I got the pink this time around and it’s a beautiful color) the sheets are thinner but don’t wrinkle and very deep pockets so I have been happy with them. The reason I put 4 star rather then 5 is because the pretty little satin ribbon lining is only on the pillowcase not the top sheet. The are a great buy for nice sheets if you can’t afford $70 sheets like me. Don’t expect them to be like Egyptian cotton because they aren’t at that price range but overall very nice sheets.
title: Great sheets for the price

author: Mel
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 18, 2020
review_content: I was so impressed with the beige sheets I purchased, I bought the white queen set (basically because they were out of almost every other color in queen size). The quality of the beige sheets is wonderful especially after washing. They feel like quality material, minimal wrinkles and a good fit.  I received the white set yesterday, put them through the wash.  I was so disappointed in how flimsy, thin and transparent they are. I expected them to be the same quality as the beige, not so.
title: Not quality material
verified: Size: EXTRA DEEP pocket - QueenColor: WhiteVerified Purchase

author: Chuck Seely
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 15, 2019
review_content: These sheets are a steal. They are comfortable in the summer and I predict they'll work just as well in SoCals mild winter temperatures. They're softer than the Hotel Collection set that these replaced- at a fraction of the cost ($23 VS $130). The fitted sheets have extra deep pockets for tucking beneath the mattress. I paired these sheets with the Amazon exclusive Tuft & Needle Nod mattress (highly recommended) and have found that the comfort exceeds the beds at the Westin, Ritz Carlton, St Regis and Marriott beds. Best of all- it's all delivered right to your doorstep for free, within 2 days. I was skeptical at first, but with a free return policy, it was a safe gamble. I've even turned on other family members onto these sheets.
title: Better than Hotel Collection sheets

author: M. Kearns
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 6, 2019
review_content: I had read so many reviews about these sheets and was sold.  Then I got them, tore my bed apart immediately to put them on, and when I went to bed was so excited to get into what I was told were wonderfully soft sheets.  I couldn't move!  I had to live my body to move, and lift my clothes to move.  Then I remembered a niece told me to never buy microfibre. They came off the very next morning.  A neighbor tol dme she had some a few years ago and got rid of hers after one night also  You may be thrilled with them, we're all different, but they weren't for me.  What doesn't work for another person works for another.  Try them for yourself.
title: Drove me nuts

author: Melinda Taylor
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 25, 2020
review_content: I wanted to love these sheets.  They are beautiful and so soft.  However with in the 3rd use they started pilling. I am a restless sleeper and I need sheets that are pill resistant. I hoped it wouldn't get worse because I loved them so much. It has. I now can't use them at all. If you are sensitive to pills on your sheets,  do not get these.
title: Butter soft but horrible pills

author: J.M. Evans
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 15, 2017
review_content: I bought this set in white and am very happy with it.  I took a chance on the microfiber because one form of microfiber can be so different from another. These are very much like a cross between soft and crisp cotton; in other words, just right for me. I have only used the sheets twice on my bed because I bought two of Joy Mangano's new sheet set that has the bottom & top sheet and dust ruffle all together in one set. one only has to put on the bottom fitted sheet and it's all done! ( I don't get anything to say that. ) But recently my daughter visited and I used these on the pull out sofa bed and she said they felt great.  They wash well and come out fairly unwrinkled if you get them out when your warning buzzer goes off.  They retain just enough crispness and the big thing for me is that there has been no pilling at all so far.  Since then, I use the pillowcases on my bed all the time partly because of the feel and also the little folds on the edging are so pretty; much prettier than they show in the picture. So I've washed those more and they are still coming ot perfect; wrinkle free and no pilling!  These sheets are far better than sets I've paid twice as much for and I definitely recommend them!
title: I bought this set in white and am very happy with it

author: Joy
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2019
review_content: I was so happy to have found sheets with such great reviews. It's exactly why I bought them. I typically buy microfiber sheets at Ross... so, no, I don't have the highest expectations or standards. Yet, these sheets have disappointed me. (I couldn't ever find a black and white set there so came to Amazon.)  Besides not being soft they are "loud". That is the word three people who slept in the guest bed have used to describe them because they are stiff and make a noise when people move about. They have faded in only three months of use with rare washings. There are strings coming out. They also do not fit my mattress which is a Zinus 10" memory foam mattress... yet they are described as "deep pocket".
title: Color faded. Poor quality.

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 30, 2019
review_content: The fabric seems nice, and I like the sheets so far, but the white color is definitely more cream/ivory than true white, which is what I was going for. Debating whether I should return or not as cream doesn't really look right with the rest of my bedding.Updated: these sheets will only fit your bed if it is EXTREMELY deep. I have an 18" mattress with another mattress topper and these sheets are huge and make the bed look wrinkly. Pillowcases are the same way, they look way too big on all of my standard pillows, even the extra fluffy down pillows that I have.Also, both the sheet and a pillowcase have snagged within two days of being on my bed - not even sure what they could have snagged on as I don't wear jewelry to bed. I've had other sheets for years and never had them snag on anything.
title: Nice fabric but wrong color - UPDATED

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 2, 2019
review_content: Holy crap did these go downhill in quality. These use to feel luxurious and were stitched so well and held up in washing and had a really good weight to them. This set.... awful!!!!! Felt like a cheap motel. Theres no longer matching stitching on the flat sheet. The decorative stitching doesn't even go all the way around the pillow case anymore..... it feels more like lining than decent quality fabric. I have 4 other sets and none were like this! I do not expect these to last for more than a couple weeks.
title: Wow quality took a nose dive. Awful set after loving 4 others.

author: M. Ondich
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 3, 2019
review_content: I am finally opening these to wash and use for the first time since buying in December. The entire side seam in one pillow case wasn't sewn properly. They sewed along the full edge, but didn't catch both pieces of fabric.They are also very thin, when I hold them up, I can see through them. I don't these will hold up for more than a couple uses after I resew the side seam, which will have to wait until I get gray thread.The one good thing is the softness.
title: Disappointing, side not sewn, poor quality.

author: Cupquake
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 20, 2019
review_content: If you're used to regular $20 sheets from your local retailer (Target, Walmart, etc) then these are a HUGE step up and I think you'll be happy with them.They don't feel like microfiber to me. They just feel like regular sheets that aren't as scratchy.I bought these as a more wallet-friendly alternative to my favorite of over 10 years: Pure Beech Jersey Knit purchased from Bed Bath Beyond, so that is what I am comparing these to.They're thin and feel like a strange type of material I can't put into words. Almost like they're not fabric, but something else entirely. I suppose that's to be expected since they're 100% polyester.I'm keeping them as a backup set since I can't be bothered to try and repackage them for a return, so they're not awful by any means.They're just not what I was looking for. Go feel some of the Pure Beech Jersey Knit for yourself and you'll know what I mean... But be prepared to drop $60 to $80 on them.
title: A step up from standard $20 sheets

author: Raven
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 27, 2020
review_content: I bought this set in grey nearly a year and a half ago. It is soft and comfortable to sleep on.The top sheet is perfect for summer days when you need some light cover.This set still looks brand new even with all it's been though.A dog who drools if you even mention food. Or he gets mud on his feed and darts back to use the sheet to wipe his feet or roll on after a bath.There has been drink/food spills.Make-up spills with a young child where the blush/eye shadow or lipstick broke falling onto the bed and still no stains.I would highly recommend this set to anyone needing a sturdy sheet set that is comfortable.The only real down side is if you have a water proof sheet below it, then you may want to get the corner holders because it can cause the fitted sheet or the water proof sheet below to slip off every once in awhile. Pretty sure though that is just a general issue not this set specifically.Update: decided to see how much color change in 18 months. The new one side by side with the old one in the pic. They look the same after that long of use. The left is the one that is currently sitting by the washer waiting to go in. The right is the new one.  I will be getting more and recommending these to family and friends.
title: Loving this set

author: K1121
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 24, 2019
review_content: This is my third order, with very different results.  I previously ordered the gold color a couple of months ago and the purple color last year.  I even ordered them as a Father’s Day gift. My previous orders were incredibly soft and felt much more luxurious than the price. Unfortunately, I just  received the burgundy color and even though I ordered the exact same sheet set, this set is a much thinner material and not nearly as soft. Even worse, they shrunk so much after one wash that I can barely squeeze them onto my queen bed. Unfortunately, since I excitedly washed them right away, I am unable to return them. Extremely disappointed that such a great product has changed for the worse.
title: Changed for the worse

author: Katelynn C.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 3, 2018
review_content: So I have had these sheets now for 3 months. They’re soft enough but the quality still leaves much to be desired. There aren’t threads coming loose left and right, some tightening in weird areas. The flat sheet is way too big so it hangs down on the sides too much and makes the bed look sloppy. Pillowcases are also larger than the should be. And finally, the elastic on the fitted sheet is garbage. I would NOT recommend these sheets to anyone. In fact I am waiting on new sheets to be delivered right now and these will be dropped to the goodwill.
title: Was good, until they weren’t

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 15, 2019
review_content: I have had these sheets for 3 weeks and I am thoroughly unimpressed with them. I came across these through one influencer or another, there are a few people out there hyping these sheets up. And they had amazing reviews so I figured for the price I’d give them a try. I had high hopes. They were quickly shattered when I received them in the mail. They felt so cheap. Yes they were soft, but they felt like a cheap soft, and so thin. But my husband for whatever reason liked the feel of them so I kept them. Three weeks in and they are horribly stained. Now my husband’s skin type is on the oily side of the spectrum. But he has never ruined sheets/pillow cases THIS quickly before. This picture was taken after the sheets were washed & dried. They are not wet. They are just stained & ruined after 3 weeks, with regular washing I might add. Awful quality, spend the extra money and get sheets that will last.PS, if you have any sort of topper on your bed the fitted sheet won’t fit over well.
title: Poor quality, stains very easily

author: Garden Gal
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 5, 2019
review_content: At first glance I noticed that these were made of very thin fabric. They are so thin that I can actually see through them when pulled taunt. However, they are incredibly soft & silky in texture so I decided to proceed with using them. I ran them through a quick, cool wash cycle & cool dry. I was a disappointed to see that they wrinkled considerably. I have one of the thinner, memory foam type mattresses so I was aware that the deeper pockets would cause certain issues. Previously I've been able to "work around" this with other sheets that were of high count cotton by tucking them tightly around the mattress. With these sheets it's impossible to do so because the first time you lie down they slip loose & you're surrounded by the looseness! In fact, this fitted sheet is HUGH! I think it would probably be to big on the thickest of mattresses. I bought these on a lightening sale but I'm still very disappointed. I hate to be critical but I would suggest that shoppers keep looking.
title: Made of the THINNEST of fabric!

author: Emma
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 21, 2019
review_content: for the price these are obviously a steal. Having a king sized bed is almost all upsides with very few cons, but the price of sheet is definitely at the top of the list of negatives. These are a great value and the coloring(I got the light grey) is a tasteful shade. however, after months of use I feel I can finally give an honest review and say everything is great minus one thing. The sheets themselves do not pill necessarily, but in a way they do. I move my feet a lot in my sleep and every few days I have to pull back the sheets and brush off the pilled fabric- this being said - it's nice that it actually brushes off rather then holding to the sheet and running the texture. I will say though, this being the case, I don't think these are going to last me much longer. But given the price I guess that's okay?
title: nice, minus one issue
verified: Size: California KingColor: Light GrayVerified Purchase

author: M. Emrich
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 2, 2019
review_content: When  I first touched our Mellanni Sheets I turned to my wife and said, "I have a feeling we will never buy any other brand of sheets again."  On cost alone nothing can possibly beat these sheet, but I was 15 minutes into our first night of sleeping on them and I was surprisingly hot.Now my wife and I are very different in what makes us comfortable. I prefer just a very light sheet touching my body at night. at least in the summer months. My wife likes to crank up our bedroom air to the temperature of a meat locker and cover herself in half a dozen blankets. But even she agreed with me. But I somehow got used to them quickly. I want to wait until summer to really be certain these deserve 5 stars. It is quite cold in Denver right now, but I may just up my rating at that time. I think the problem is that these just don't breathe like a fine cotton, but they still have a unique and wonderful feel to them. I got adventurous and ordered the coral. I really love the color. I will almost certainly be buying some other colors soon.10/29/19-I just upped my review from 4 stars to 5. i now have 3 sets of Mellanni sheets.  I must be use to it, but that initial breathing issue is not something I feel at this point. Maybe I am used to it, maybe I was picky before. Not sure. Just know these are great sheets at an unbeatable price.
title: So  I only had one little issue.

author: Nancy O
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 4, 2020
review_content: After reviewing SO many sheets purchased two sets for new king size bed. Bad move! These super soft and wrinkle-free inexpensive sheets just do not breathe and are very uncomfortable to sleep in. Even my husband, who requires extra heat and multiple blankets on his side, dislikes how "clammy" they make him feel. We fought the loosely fitted sheet - our new 14" mattress is deep but not deep enough to keep the fitted sheet in place as we tossed and turned to try and stay cool. I've learned "deep" mattresses range from 10-20". That's a BIG range to find a fitted sheet that will stay on. Read the fine print and look for natural fiber and pocket depth. We are back to higher weave cotton sheets - pricier but much better sleep.
title: Synthetic doesn't  breathe - hot & deeply uncomfortable. Measure mattress before ordering.

author: Dori2003
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 30, 2018
review_content: I'm baffled by the number of positive reviews for these sheets. They're super thin and the material, while soft, feels very low-quality. I haven't been using them long but I don't see them holding up well. The corners of the fitted sheet don't stay on well. Also, they're not "wrinkle resistant" by any stretch of the term - mine are covered in wrinkles, even when folded straight out of the dryer. Very disappointed and definitely will not purchase again.
title: Super Thin & Wrinkle Easily

author: Stephanie Ann
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 8, 2020
review_content: I had very high hopes for these sheets but was severely disappointed. I loved the pattern and from the reviews, these looked like good sheets. They weren’t good or even fair. They feel super cheap and make a crinkling noise when you lay on them. But that wasn’t the worst part. Neither was the fact that the elastic on the edge of the fitted sheet was like the inside of a plastic shower cap. The thinnest and cheapest elastic I’ve ever seen on bedsheets. They say deep pockets, but they didn’t fit my 15 in bed. The worst part was the staining. Putting the sheets in the washer made my hands black from the dye. Even after washed, the dye from the sheets were on my toddlers feet and legs from jumping around on the bed. Luckily it didn’t stain our mattress but it stained pretty much everything else the top of the sheets touched. Not one review mentions dye staining so maybe I just got a bad batch of sheets? Even though they specifically say dye stain free. I sent them back right away and got a 100% cotton set from another seller that is absolutely amazing. Don’t regret sending these sheets back at all. Very disappointed.
title: Dye Stained my hands and my toddlers legs and feet!

author: SLC
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 31, 2019
review_content: I ordered these caving into all the reviews and advertisements of a "must try" sheet. I usually only buy linen or cotton sheets. Here is my take on this set of sheets.1. Cost ( no brainer) even if its for a back up set get these sheets2. Fit Gets a negative from me. They are much too big and the pillow cases look ridiculously large on my King Size pillows!3. They are thin not allot of weight to them. Made me feel like I wasnt on a sheet, which I don't necessarily like.4. No Wrinkles at All but ill fitting so they bunch up or there is extra fabric hanging off the pillows. Aesthetically that makes it not very pleasing to the eye.5. Stain resistant. All stains came out ( my dogs sleep in my bed) one happen to put these to the test! He got sick which contained carrots not an easy stain. But it came out.6. Soft yes because they are microfiber again not a huge fan of.7. So hey I will use them as a back up set but will not buy again.
title: DECIDED TO SEE WHAT ALL THE HYPE WAS ABOUT

author: kevin moriarty
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 25, 2019
review_content: Purchased after reading an article on Marketwatch financial website stating that these were THE best sheets to buy under $50 ......Ummm,no !  Absolute garbage , 1 wash stitchings on seams came out wrapping around the sheets in many different places leaving a jumbled , knotted mess . Extremely thin and cheap material. We have other similar microfiber sheets we love, these were a waste of money. Or a knock off of the brand. Highly disappointed .
title: Do Not Buy !

author: Pauline Rusinich
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 19, 2018
review_content: Yes soft. Sheets don't stay on bed.. I'm fixing them 2 times a day. The elastic that holds them is minimal. I wish I bought my usual more expensive sheets from the company store.  King size pillow case are ample. Lavender color is pretty..Fits my 13 inch mattress but as stated before they slip off very easy1
title: Doesn't stay on bed. Slips off 2 times a night

author: James
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 13, 2017
review_content: UPDATED REVIEWIn the picture the sheets look like a vintage rose kind of pink but in reality they're more like a bright bubble gum colored pink. I have to say though that they are incredibly soft. I just wish the color was more like the picture.***These sheets are practically see through! When I washed them and put them on the bed I realized that you can see the mattress pattern right through the sheet. It looks so tacky and now I'm really disappointed. This wasn't what I expected at all.
title: Bubble gum pink!

author: Katie G
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 9, 2019
review_content: Honestly, I’m a pretty low maintenance person, and by the 50k positive reviews I thought these would be great, but I’ve had them for several months and I give them an F. They are SUPER SUPER thin, not soft, and they stain very easily. I’ve washed them consistently, and even after washing them they are stained with GOD knows what. We don’t really eat in bed, and all we really ever do is sleep but there are strange stains that just won’t come out. It should be noted that my husband gets spray tans, which could account for some of the staining- but it’s not permanent tan, so it’s strange that it just won’t wash out. These are gross and I’m going to have to replace them ALREADY. I’ve only been using them for 4 months. I’m not a sheet snob, and like I said I didn’t expect them to be this bad....
title: I’m low maintenance and I thought these were awful
verified: Size: California KingColor: Light GrayVerified Purchase

author: Kupins
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 7, 2017
review_content: We ordered these sheets because they look awsome. They fit perfectly on our Queen bed. They are soft. Smooth and the color is so bright. The only problem is on the first day we decided to "use" the sheets. We "used them several times that night.  We woke up to a blue canvas where bob ross painted a bunch of happy clouds. We washed the sheets right away but even after 2 rinses the stains would not come out. Very sad since i liked the sheets.
title: Will stain.

author: Car
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 19, 2020
review_content: Can we talk about sheet buying anxiety?! I put this off for YEARS! I would shop around get overwhelmed by the large selection and differing reviews and just give up, blocking it from my mind. That is until I got down to my last sheet. I read so many mixed reviews on this set and was very nervous once I had purchased them that maybe I had made a mistake. Absolutely couldn't have been more wrong! These guys are the BOMB. Like that silky cool feeling when you climb into bed and stretch your legs out, that can only be taken to the next level if you have freshly shaven legs! They have washed great, no piling and no fading. The orange is vibrant and fun! Top sheets have always been so dumb to me like why in 2020 are we still including them in the set? Well this top sheet had me rethinking all my previous hard no's in life, because sliding in the bed between the fitted sheet and this top sheet is like and out of body experience. Just cool silky smooth softness encasing everything ya got.
title: Let your sheet hunt end here

author: Ruth Wyatt
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 15, 2020
review_content: I purchased these sheets after reading some very positive reviews on Amazon and online elsewhere.  When I first used them, I was pleased by how soft they seemed as was my daughter for whom I also bought these sheets.  The next day, however, we both noticed that they were stained, from what I cannot say.  While I do not think they came stained (though perhaps they did), I think they are too easily stained.  Although I washed them immediately, the stains did not come out.  To give perspective on my sheet use,  all other sheets I have used, despite years of wear and tear, generally remain unstained, except for one or two sets after many years.  After all the glowing reviews,  I was very disappointed indeed.
title: Not stain proof

author: Jeremy
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 27, 2020
review_content: Im confused by the positive reviews and how some say these are the best sheets. Either you all got different sheets than me or there is something fishy going on. From the second i took these sheets out of the package i could tell they were low quality. The moment i opened them up and took a look at them, i could practically see through the sheet. I have never in my life enountered a set of sheets so thin, and that was just the start. I then put them in the wash according to the directions on the tag. Took them out of the wash where they looked absolutely fine. Put them on low for 30 mins in the dryer because i knew there was no way they needed more time than that since they were so thin. 30 minutes passes and I take them out, and to my surprise, the main sheet had these random stains all over it, yet the other did not. Also to throw a cherry on top of that. The mattress sheet seemed to have just disentigrated in the wash or dryer, because there were small holes in certain sections of the sheet that were not there before i washed them. Basically it all boils down to me being beyond pissed off at this low quality product, to the point where i just went to a store to buy proper sheets. Do yourself a favor and just go to the store where you can see and feel the quality of the sheets. I do not reccommend these to anyone.I do not throw around 1 stars lightly, but there was nothing redeeming about this product for me to give it anymore than that.
title: Worst sheets ever!

author: Sheena Ashley
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 1, 2019
review_content: Literally the softest sheets I’ve ever felt!!!!! I bought our first set, tossed them in the washer/dryer and as I was putting them on the guest bed I noticed these strange grease looking stains on both sheets(pillow cases were fine). This is the reason for my 4 star review. I thought it just had to be a fluke. I contacted customer service and they promptly got a new set to me. I pulled them out and inspected the new set prior to washing this time. EXACT SAME THING...just different areas. I’ve come to accept that this is just how these sheets or maybe this particular color are. I washed and put them on he bed anyways and my guests said they were the best sheets they have ever slept on and begged to know where we got them at!!!! Definitely worth the buy but bummed that they have funky spots on them!! I went ahead and gave durability 5 stars but I’ll update as needed once they get more use/washes!!
title: So soft!!!

author: Becki S.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 29, 2018
review_content: Great color and even feel great. But, the fitted sheet shrank after the first wash and dry. Now it is tight and doesn’t even go to the base of my mattress. I bought this sheet set for it’s “promised” deep pockets. Now, the fitted sheet is no better than buying a setof cheaper quality.
title: Doesn’t have the deep pockets as described.

author: Williams
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 9, 2020
review_content: These are the same Mellanni sheets they sell on Wayfair for a few dollars more. They are not the highest quality, but they're still nice enough. They are quite thin, but mine haven't ripped or gotten any holes just yet. I mainly got them for the color -- I was looking for a rusty/spicy orange/brown, and most reviewers of the "mocha" said that's exactly what this color is. Um, NOPE. It's definitely a rich mocha brown, but it does have a hint of a rusty orange in the right light. It's not exactly the color I wanted, but tbh for $30 sheets I can't and wont complain. This brand offers lots of hard to find colors at a low price, and they're a decent alternative while you're saving up for the Anthro/West Elm/Pottery Barn sheets you REALLY want. They fit just fine on my regular-thickness mattress with gel topper, are snug and dont move around or wrinkle during the night. They're surprisingly really soft after 1-2 washes. Not sure why anyone would complain unless they received defective merch (when complaining is justified), they're not hotel quality Egyptian cotton sheets, they're just a decent sheet set that will get you through.
title: Great for what they are

author: Charity Vanosdol
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 9, 2020
review_content: I bought3 sets only received 2 I was bummed. The Sheets are so soft and smooth when I slip in between my sheets it feels like I'm slipping into a soft cloud.  Sheets are as described except one set had a problem with pilling. The other set is perfect! Just because you get one bad set shouldn't ruin it for the rest right. It's the one bad apple question? You read the reviews and make up your own mind!
title: comfort
verified: Size: Twin XLColor: Pin Stripe GrayVerified Purchase

author: Bonecrusher
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 1, 2019
review_content: The comfort of this sheet is quite good for the price. However it isn’t a true deep pocket sheet set. The fitted sheet is poorly designed. When placing it on your bed (Mine is 14 inches high) it seems to fit quite well. However, one you lay in the bed it’s very clear the fitted portion of this sheet set is only designed to actually stay wrapped around the entire mattress as long as someone isn’t in the bed. It comes halfway up along the sides, foot, and head of the bed and ONLY stays fitted to the corners of the mattress. This isn’t what I would expect from such a highly self touted sheet set. I’m accustomed to a fitted sheet staying fitted so around the entire mattress. Once you lay on the fitted sheet it gets a “slippery” feel as it comes untucked and creates extra loose fabric on the top of the mattress, instead of staying firmly fitted as advertised. The comfort of the sheets are quite cooling I will admit. It’s too bad the manufacturer didn’t put enough quality into the fitted sheet though.
title: Fitted sheet doesn’t stay fitted unless you’re not laying in the bed!!!

author: Greg Allgrim
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 20, 2020
review_content: These sheets are proof of why you need to take Amazon reviews (holy cow, even in the thousands) with a strong grain of salt.  Listen, you get what you pay for and these sheets would be outstanding in a shelter for people in need (don’t get picky at the shelter).  But if you have any kind of taste, these sheets would appall you.  I first noticed a problem when they wouldn’t settle on the bed due to a ceiling fan being on...they wanted to fly away.  Then you sleep on them, and listen...I’m in the military, and I’ve slept in more comfortable tarps than this.  These sheets “swoosh” when you move, and like someone else mentioned, they are so hot that I got menopause (as a man!).  I seriously thought I had COVID19 when I woke up in a sweat. Do yourself a favor...don’t be a cheapskate and just buy yourself decent sheets.
title: No, no, no, and no.

author: Brett
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 22, 2020
review_content: I can not comprehend why an influencer recommends these or why they have such a good rating. They’re 100% polyester and 100% feel chemically made. They are like a cheap a Halloween costume from Walmart. They are soft but not in a cozy way, more of a swishy way. We put them on, went to sleep and both my husband and I slept awful. I hate them so much. They look nice and that’s it. I care way more about my sleep than about the look. I would recommend spending on extra 20-40 bucks on cotton sheets that won’t cause chemical burn.
title: These are my worst purchase

author: Kim T.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 22, 2019
review_content: I received my sheets today and washed them 1 time and the stitching fell out of the pillow cases.. I will be returning. The quality is not acceptable.
title: I don't recommend
verified: Size: FullColor: Striped – Gray / SilverVerified Purchase

author: El Reviewer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 28, 2019
review_content: I'll be honest, the last sheets I bought from Amazon were le crap. They were Amazon brand and about as thin as my toilet paper. About as comfortable as the toilet paper would be too (or so I hear...(shifty eyes)).At $25, I figured no way these were worth the hype. Tons of 5 star reviews. I honestly just wanted regular sheets, but these things have blown me away. They're light and airy, kind of like the foam on top of a cappuccino. Ultra soft and smooth, seemingly breathable, and despite my place being sweltering at the moment, I find myself quite comfortable.I like these so much that I even bought a 2nd and 3rd pair. The review above is regarding the grey sheets. The 2nd purchase was for the navy blue ones, which I'm going to say I don't like as much. Comfort-wise, they're the equivalent. My issue is that anything and everything dirt and dust related shows the second after you step into them.I like to think I'm a clean person. Physically. My mind is a different story... but I digress. Literally the 2nd time I got into them, I had myself second guessing whether I'd actually just put them on my bed the day before.Whatever. I'm getting long winded. The grey ones. Awesome. Bought a backup set for those. Probably just as dirty, but you can't see it, so it's like it's not there. Just buy a pair. Don't believe the boujee types that complain these aren't soft. For $25, they're plenty soft. Soft like my belly after a Cinnabon fast. Sorry they're not 10000 thread count Egyptian sheets. Wrong target market.
title: Wow

author: Sunny
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 28, 2020
review_content: I purchased these sheets twice. The first sheet set I bought (navy blue, quatrefoil) was absolutely great. The material was super soft, - despite of it being made of polyester- which made it feel more like smooth silk than something synthetic. In addition, it wasn't in the least static even after drying it completely in the dryer. My hubby LOVED these sheets, and so I decided to purchase another set, but this time in silver -gray quatrefoil.WHAT A DIFFERENCE IN QUALITY!!!The fabric of the gray set is so thin and static, the sheets and pillow case simply cling to the comforter/ pillow, not allowing you to even have the semblance of a 'made bed'. The material behaves like the material of which really, really cheap Halloween costumes are made. I couldn't even make it through one night of sleeping on them...they even clung to me/ my (cotton) pajamas.  And, no, I didn't ruin them by washing them too hot. In addition, I dried them on LOW and even took them out before they were completely dry, so as to avoid static ( or so I thought...!). I washed them three times in hopes that things would get better....they didn't. Very disappointing.
title: A quality product no more....!
verified: Size: Twin XLColor: Quatrefoil Navy BlueVerified Purchase

author: elaine cochran
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 28, 2019
review_content: Over 51,000 reviews and nearly 5 stars... Can a set of sheets really be that remarkable? Yeah, they can. These are awesome, affordable sheets. I have purchased 9 sets so far for myself and some short-term rentals. They're incredibly soft and comfortable, they wash well, and don't wrinkle easily. What more can you really ask for? Heads up, they fit a little loosely on the majority of my mattresses. However, that is fine by me. It makes making the bed snappy and keeps me from having to hurt myself while wrestling with a fitted sheet to get it on. Added bonus, the customer service is fantastic. I had an issue with one set not fitting my queen mattress (which now I believe was just a full-sized sheet mismarked as a queen), and they were so very kind and fair and rectified the situation promptly. These are sellers that stand behind their product and value their customers, and they go the mile to prove it. Needless to say, from my experience, I believe that this seller and their sheets have indeed earned their 51,000+ reviews and nearly 5-star rating. I'll be back for more when the time comes.
title: Too good to be true?

author: GD
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 24, 2019
review_content: My sheets have come in good shape, no rips or stains and everything matched. Updating my original review gave them a 5 now instead of a 4. Have had them longer and still love them that I have bought another pair of Ca King sheets in dark gray and a matching duvet cover. Really love these sheets. They are light, nothing fancy about them but they are cool and very, very soft. There is stitching on end of pillow cases but not the sheets.  I don't wash these sheets with towels or blankets and my older sheets haven't gotten balls or piling. These replaced Macy's Hotel Collection that never softened up and were too heavy, and Targets top brand.These are soft, comfortable and wash well. The corner elastic is not as tight as more expensive sheets but I have not had trouble with them coming off. My mattress is about 13"+ deep Cal King,  with room in sheets to spare. However for this price I would add the clip on corner holders if they loosen up.Sheets-So maybe a negative is they aren't fancy, but at this price who cares.Duvet-Just the same as sheets, color matched, buttons not a zipper, lots of room, comes with two pillow cases and 2 shams.Duvet-Maybe a negative is they come with ties on the inside and one fell off, no rips, I don't use them anyway. Easy to fix.I'm planning on buying more colors.....
title: Very comfortable sheets
verified: Size: California KingColor: Light GrayVerified Purchase

author: PippyB
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 7, 2019
review_content: C'mon Grown and Flown Parents, you failed me with your recommendation for these sheets. I'm more into natural organic cotton, which is usually soft, durable, and breathable.These Mellanni sheets felt thin and cheap, like sleeping on a sheet made of old-fashioned slips, the kind worn beneath dresses. The fitted sheet er, slipped around and did not feel taught around the mattress. It's the kind of sheet that if I'd been sleeping on in a motel, I'd have felt the need for more of a barrier between myself and the mattress.I immediately placed these new (but laundered) Mellani sheets into a shopping bag and donated them to the local charity shop. I felt I wasted my money.
title: Thin like an old-fashioned slip

author: Lexi H.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2019
review_content: I love these sheets. So soft and so comfy. I'm a little crazy about my linens and usually spend hundreds of dollars on sheets, pillows, and duvet covers. Most of my life, I was the snobby "will only use 1000 thread count Egyptian cotton pure white sheets"... then I got married and my husband sweats like he's trying to water a garden in our bed. I could not get the stains out of his side of the bed even with bleach so I started using darker colored linens. Still didn't work. I ended up just throwing sheets out and buying new ones every month. This got very expensive so I had to give up the nice sheets and get something more affordable. I came across these and thought I'd try them. I was so pleasantly surprised. I loved them so much that I bought sets for every bed in the house: my kids, guest room, extra sets for my own King bed, plus 4 extra sets just to have for blow up mattresses, sofa bed, etc. (I have a huge family and they tend to visit often). My aunt loved sleeping on them so much that I actually gave her one of my extra sets to take home. You can't beat these sheets at this price.
title: Love these sheets!

author: AJ and Cinthya
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 5, 2018
review_content: When I first opened the package I noticed that he sheets were very thin, almost translucent even, and that the sheets did not match the pictures in terms of the stripes because there really weren't any. But I decided to give them a shot and washed/dried them based on their recommendation prior to using them. The dryer filter wash absolutely filled with lint and thought that maybe this was a one time thing. Even from day one they fit terribly on the bed. The fitted sheet wasn't snug around the mattress (we have Casper mattress so it isn't small or thin by any means) and we noticed that the fabric constantly pills, to the point that I can actually grab some with my bare hands. All in all, if it sounds too good to be true, it probably is. I'm off to Costco to get new bed sheets now.
title: Not at all what you see in the pictures!

author: Ray Finkle
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 9, 2019
review_content: I’m a total snob when it comes to bedding. I’ve spent countless thousands on mattresses, pillows and sheets. I didn’t trust the sheets at my parents house so I bought them some of these as a “thank you” prior to my arrival. I was pleasantly surprised.These sheets don’t feel very durable, but they are soft, lightweight and worth more than their amazon price tag. I’ve spent 5x this on sheets that felt like sandpaper. Happy to sleep on them any time. They are soft, silky, lightweight, and luxurious.
title: Bedding snob gives thumbs up

author: GradStudent
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 22, 2017
review_content: These sheets are made of a soft micro-fiber. While they are nice to the touch, a few days of use have proved them to be of poor quality. The sheets are pilling and wrinkling underneath my body as I sleep, leaving marks on my skin and small fabric pieces all over the bed. The fitted sheet continues to become looser and looser with each use. What I find most upsetting is how HOT the sheets are. If you get hot in the night, you will simply be stuck in what I found to be a heated cocoon of wrinkled torture. Unlike cotton sheets, these retain heat and do not wick sweat-- so you will stay sweaty and uncomfortable throughout the night. Wish I could return.
title: HOT and CHEAP

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 19, 2020
review_content: I understand that microfiber contains polyester and Im not sure if it matters to anyone else, but these are 100% polyester. These sheets do feel kinda soft, I don’t think they’d be terrible to sleep in, but they’re super thin and feel very cheaply made. I can see my hand thru them. I have not washed yet, but they are super wrinkled out of the package. There are several threads hanging out so, Im really concerned about the stitching quality. If you’re not picky about sheets and just want something cost efficient- not a bad buy for the cheap price. However, these are NOT high quality sheets. I’m not that picky, I think my current sheets are 100% cotton and around 300-500 thread count, but I will not be using these. I’ll be returning.
title: 100% polyester, Not high quality, feel/look cheaply made

author: Peach1
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 22, 2019
review_content: Bought these for our Cal King Sleigh bed with Tempurpedic mattress. They wer silky feeling which I wasn't to sure about - a bit slippery.  After using them, we're frustrated that we seen to need to remake the bed every morning.  We're in our late 60's so there isn't a party in the bed nightly and we're not fitful sleepers BUT, the corners seem to come untucked constantly and we wake up sleeping on the mattress pad with the sheets in disarray.  We washed them before using and we've slept on them so don't think they are returnable.  SO, do we put up with the daily remake or do these go in the 'give away' pile?  hmmm
title: Updating my review: Don't recommend
verified: Size: California KingColor: Quatrefoil Silver - GrayVerified Purchase

author: Up north Red
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 10, 2018
review_content: Good price but found them thin, elastic around fitted sheet flimsy and after one washing pilled leaving sheet scratchy.Update on this review: after using after first washing, the pilling became so bad (even after using a depilling device) it was truly uncomfortable to lay on due to eternal scratching with movement. Will cut up for use as rags, but not sure they will even work as that. Wonder how it can be rated top seller on Amazon
title: One Star

author: Natalie
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 22, 2019
review_content: I have been stuck on cotton all these years, and I can't believe I've been missing out on the world's most comfortable sheets!!! They are the softest most comfortable sheets I have ever experienced outside of a hotel room. We have 2 twin extra long Craftmatic 'deep mattress' beds pushed together, and it is difficult to find sheets. The sheets are not only plush, but they have extremely deep pockets and secure elastic. The elastic moves within the hem, so you're not stuck with a 'one size fits all' sheet-and there is room to spare. No more tearing sheets to pull them tightly over the corners. (Also easier on my back when making the bed!) They were not 'hotter' than my other sheets, my body temperature felt exactly the same to me. In fact, it is almost 12 noon right now and the dog will not get out of bed. I made the bed and she dug the covers back to get her body in between those sheets –that's how comfortable they are!
title: Hey, I'm a Believer Now!!

author: G. Gardner
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 24, 2019
review_content: Leaving a neutral rating as I have not tried the sheets yet, but as I was shopping I wished someone would have posted a picture of what the true color of the yellow was & there was none. So I'm posting one now. It is more of a bright, Canary yellow vs the kind of mustard color that shows.
title: Yellow Sheets True Color

author: Robert W Brown
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 9, 2019
review_content: Fore years I have stuck with 600 thread count cotton sheets , but they do tend to hold in heat and make you sweat. So I heard about sheex  saw their price and looked for an alternative. I thought I found them at first in these sheets , but after a few days they started to show their down side.  When you first put them on the bed they are amazing almost like silk sheets ,BUT after a few days and yes sweating at night minimally they stick to you like glue. Needless to say I am back to my Cotton sheets and sleeping much better.  Now I'm just trying to think of what to do with these brand new sheets other than throw them away !
title: Stick with high thread count cotton sheets

author: Taylor
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 8, 2020
review_content: These sheets are the best thing i have ever purchased. I wanted to try something better then deep pocketed walmart sheets because they are never deep enough for my mattresses. I bought these after reading reviews about how they feel cheap and how they aren't wrinkle free. Those reviews must be really picky because these are definitely hotel quality sheets. They fit perfect and stay on even with people who move a lot when they sleep. The do wrinkle a little bit but what sheets don't. These are very soft and the colors are amazing. I have yet to try and wash them. I will update when i do.
title: Amazing.

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 21, 2020
review_content: I chose this sheet set because it was advertised as extra deep pockets. I liked the color (grey) and the stripes. Unlike the other deep pocket sheet sets that were available, this set had only 2 pillow cases (others had 4 pillow cases). The pockets were NOT as deep and did not fit my deep mattress set like the other sheet sets that were offered. I know because this is my second purchase of this particular variety of deep pocket sheet sets. My advice : Don't fall for the color or pretty grey stripes!
title: This Sheet Set Is Inferior In Fit and Quality
verified: Size: KingColor: Striped – Gray / SilverVerified Purchase

author: Michelle
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 26, 2020
review_content: We bought these sheets a little over a year ago when we needed something quick and inexpensive. I normally buy 100% cotton sheets from a local store, but decided to take a chance on these sheets, which were far less than half the price we pay for our usual sheets. We were pleasantly surprised at how soft and comfortable these sheets are! We bought the baby blue, and the color has held up beautifully through many, many washes, and the sheets are still just as comfortable as they were when we first bought them. We haven't had any of the issues with excessive wrinkling or edges of the fitting sheet slipping off the mattress, as other reviewers state.  Give them a try and see how comfortable microfiber sheets can be!
title: A year later and I'm still in love with these sheets

author: Lisa Johnson
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 2, 2021
review_content: DO NOT PURCHASE!!!  The WORST Sheets I’ve ever seen. I was so excited about getting an 1800 thread count sheet set. I just recently redid my master bedroom including new paint, duvet etc. and I ordered these Violet Queen size sheets from Mellanni. I had never heard of this brand before but the description says 1800 thread count, stain resistant, wrinkle resistant… How could you go wrong?? Well, evidently, many ways. I use several pillows so I ordered the queen size sheet set and additionally a set of king size pillowcases as I usually layer large pillows on the bottom and then the queen then I decorative pillow on top. I always wash my sheets/clothes before I use/wear them. They were shipped separately, why I don’t know, but I got the sheets first and just waited until the pillowcases came. I was in a hurry and didn’t check everything out closely like I usually do. I opened both packages and threw them in the washing machine “by themselves” with a tide pod. Threw them in the dryer with a bounce sheet.  I remove them at the end of the cycle while it was still tumbling it was in cool down At end of dryer cycle, which also is supposed to help on the wrinkling of items. As soon as I pulled one item out I was just shocked!! I have never had any material that wrinkled so badly. I took them to the bed and laid them out and I see the stains all over several areas of the sheets and pillowcases. It almost looked like grease stains, for lack of a better example, much darker then the sheets. Again, they were in alone with nothing but a tide pod and in the dryer with just a bounce dryer sheet. All pieces were extremely wrinkled and to add one more problem, they were two different colors. When I went to look at the packaging they were both the same name brand they were both supposed to be Violet. And then I look at the packaging for the sheets and they had sent me a king size instead of a queen. This has nothing to do with “them getting confused because I ordered king size pillowcases” because, as I said, they were shipped separately. Thank God this was ordered through Amazon because they took them back immediately and credited my card. See pictures for proof of all that I have posted. Remember these did not sit in the dryer it was still tumbling when removed. When I first called customer service they kept trying to talk me into trying another set. I did what I should’ve done in the beginning and started looking at the reviews starting with the one star and found that all of these things have been a problem for other customers. I don’t know how people could have sheet sets that reviewed out at five?? Maybe when made in China or wherever outside of the US, was it different material? different dye jobs? I have no idea. Just save yourself the headache because Alvaro they refunded me, you still have to print the labels and go down to the UPS store.
title: DON’T PURCHASE, Highly wrinkled, stained and different colors.

author: chillychill
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 22, 2018
review_content: I wanted some to try out. These are cheap knock offs maybe from China. The bottom sheet is too big for a regular mattress. You need a double thick one for the sheet fit correctly. The material feels like cheap rayon. I don’t know if I’d call them soft more like a plastic silky feeling. I’ve noticed lately that the quality of the cheaper products on Amazon have gone down. Amazon still has great products Though! If you usually spend $50 to $100 for sheets like me, I’d suggest spending $60 to $80, usually paying that price will get you $150 set on Amazon. If you want good quality for a cheaper price when it comes to certain things, target and even Walmart have better quality. For sheets I’ll go to Marshall’s or Ross moving forward... if I want to spend under $40’bucks. I had to try them though!
title: Eh... not worth $30

author: Maggie May
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 5, 2019
review_content: I washed, dried and slept in the sheets the first day I got them.  Now, there were a few dye stains on the fabric, the bottom sheet fit fine, the top sheet was a little narrow for my liking, and the overall stitching was poor.  There is elastic all around the bottom sheet, so that was good.  I cannot speak to long term wear, but having said that, the past two nights I have slept great!  The sheets are soft and really comfortable. They do not wrinkle.  I have purchased sheets significantly more expensive and with better manufacturing quality, but I can buy 4 sets of sheets each year for what I spent on quality, mega thread count, Egyptian cotton or bamboo sheets!  And yes, is the quality a bit lax sure, but I make my bed daily and cover the whole thing with a beautiful duvet and piles of pillows, so I don't care.  What I care about is the comfort and true value I got on these sets.  Long term wear, I'll  have to get back to you on that one.
title: Value for the money

author: Dr. Mike
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 21, 2020
review_content: The sheets are worth every penny. They are very comfortable. Super soft and durable. They fit my very deep mattress very well without a shortage of material to tuck in. Nothing more frustrating than having sheets that seem like they’re too small for the bed. They did not smell weird and did not bleed out when I washed them.This is an update. I noticed that the stitching opened up on one of my pillowcases. I emailed the customer service department directly and this company was very good at sending me out another set of pillowcases. They stand behind their product and I would still highly recommend their products.
title: Hard to beat this sheet
verified: Size: EXTRA DEEP pocket - Cal KingColor: BurgundyVerified Purchase

author: ashley93_love
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 11, 2020
review_content: I started researching the top sheets to buy and after finding one or two on amazon, I started seeing that there were some sheets that weren’t listed on any of those sites, but they had +10,000 purchases. I made the assumption that these sheets must be great if they have that many purchases. I ended up purchasing 5 different brands of sheets and these are the 3rd that I’ve tried. These sheets are very soft and I would have bought them at a store if I felt them. The color that I bought is super beautiful. However, I’ve learned a thing or two after trying a couple of these sheets, and one of the things I’ll be looking for now, is sheets that let your body breath. These sheets do not do that. Usually I run hot and my spouse runs cold and we can’t agree on a temperature or how many blankets to have on the bed. I have been overheating at night and my spouse has made comments about feeling the same way once or twice (but he’s mostly comfortable). Now I’m a little chubby and he’s pretty thin, but the first set of sheets we tried actually let our bodies breath. We could finally agree on a temperature and how many blankets to have on our bed with those ones. These ones have just reminded me that there’s more than just softness to a sheet. They don’t go down my mattress as far as I would like but they haven’t pulled off in the week we’ve had them on. The picture of the side of my bed shows how bad they ride up. This was right after I had pulled them down and then sat on the bed for a couple minutes. Overall, I don’t think I’ll be buying them again but if you care about softness more than anything, then they are great.
title: Super soft but I overhear at night with them

author: Amy
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 8, 2019
review_content: I purchased these a year ago. They were ok for a few months but then started coming up after sleeping on them. They are not made for deep mattresses/pillow toppers. I measured ahead of time to make sure I purchased the correct sheets and now I have to put the bed sheet back on daily from coming loose at night. Super disappointed! I really had high expectations from all the positive reviews! :( :( The elastic is also not tight like a normal bed sheet would be. It’s cheaply made and overpriced.
title: Does not stay snug/comes loose! Poor quality.

author: M.D.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2019
review_content: Our favorite sheets suffered a rip and had to be tossed. I wanted sheets with the same softness and these fit the bill. The old sheets were 100% cotton but these are not, and I'm happy to say I'm satisfied with the feeling equally as the old onesUpdate: I raved about the softness Of these sheets before I put them on the bed. Upon making the bed with them, I realized only two of the corners of the fitted sheet are elastic, two are not. As you can guess, it lead to having to remake those corners daily because they do not stick to the mattress. Very disappointing, and unfortunately I waited too long to try them out so my return window has closed.So yes, they are soft, but I do not feel them worth it with the poor quality of the fitted sheet.
title: Soft but made poorly

author: Chelsea
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 9, 2016
review_content: I was looking for sheets this last December to match my new bed set. I wanted black, soft sheets. Reading reviews about the Mellanni sheets... "it's like two soft angels hugging me in my sleep".... lies to whomever wrote that.I received these and stuck my finger thru the side to feel them and they felt super soft. I was excited and couldn't wait to use them. Several months later, I finally opened them, washed them and started putting them on my bed. They seem cheap, like if I pull too hard or if my finger digs too hard I might rip it. (Making the bed nowadays is a gentle process) The material isn't very thick and not as soft as I read or was hoping for. The tag to the flat sheet is on the top part of the sheet opposed to the bottom where it should be.I find that my clothes will stick to the fabric, which drives me crazy!!! So all my pjs and under roos have stretched out from the constant turning I do while the garments want to stick in place.So, for the price,  they are decent, but definitely not angel worthy... or clothes worthy for that matter.
title: Where are my soft angels?

author: TheMandyP
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 30, 2020
review_content: I am not a fan of microfiber sheets at all, I definitely prefer cotton all the way. But these sheets have changed my mind on that. I ordered a set for my son's room because I found a color that would coordinate with his new comforter set (which came with sheets that were way too small). The amount of positive reviews and the price made me feel like these would work while I kept looking for some cotton ones. I was very impressed with these! Its been 5 months and they are still so soft and have not pilled . They feel a bit like Jersey blend but don't sag and stretch out like jersey sheets tend to. They are also very stain resistant. When I purchase sheets for my own bed, I will purchase me a set of these.
title: Amazingly Soft

author: A. Baker
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 25, 2019
review_content: I love good linens.  So with over 50,000 reviews I figured why not?!  First of all, ironing your sheets is fairly unnecessary no matter what so the "OMG they don't wrinkle," argument is unnecessary.They feel like polyester, the hand is NOT like Egyptian Cotton, it's like the synthetic material it really is.  The elastic does NOT fit anywhere near 16".  12-14" maybe, but it stretches the sheet so tight I was worried I'd never get it off again.These are not a natural fiber, and, therefore, are HOT, I mean HOT.  I am always, always cold, so I figured even a little warmth would be ok.  No, these sheets do not breathe, they just trap whatever heat your body gives off and keeps you in that heat.  So, you wake up sweaty and wishing you could have your real sheets back.A $40 price tag for a set of Queen sheets sounds great until you realize they aren't any good.  Do yourself a favor, find ACTUAL Egyptian Cotton sheets from a real linen store and enjoy an actual good nights sleep on sheets that breathe, and wash up like a dream every time.  Oh, and for those of you who are worried about wrinkled sheets, just take them out of the dryer a few minutes early and you're good to go.  No ironing necessary.  Save the microfiber for cleaning your electronics.
title: If you know good sheets, these aren't good sheets.

author: Heather H
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 9, 2019
review_content: I definitely had to give them a try after all of the stellar reviews! I am a linen snob, so I had to compare.Pros:Cheap, great color (I got the navy blue, but I’ve realized I really only like light colored sheets) beside the point, because it was very true to the color I expected. These sheets are soft, and stretchy (which will be added to my cons personally), but they didn’t come off the corners, so that’s a plus.Cons: it’s hard to give feedback on these because sleep is so personal, so I’m just going to say what I don’t like for myself. They were almost too stretchy, so there’s wasn’t a tight fit and they bunch up if you’re a mover in your sleep. Using the top sheet was just too much for me, very warm and with the stretchiness, made it hard to sleep. That’s  pretty much it for cons, I guessOverall, if I just use the fitted sheet, they are ok. Great for some backup sheetsThus, my snobby review of the “Best sheets” on amazon.
title: Soft, true to color, stretchy.

author: Kevin D. Fischer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 21, 2019
review_content: So many people say great things about these. I have never spent a lot of money on sheets. This wasn't a lot so I just had to buy because I just bought more Ghostbed pillows. I seriously considered their sheets but really I can't pay that much money on sheets! I have to admit these are really nice and soft. I've noticed they are cooler and I'm not sweating. I have two Ghostpillows and I noticed the other night as I had my arm draped on one and head on other and realized my arm felt cool. Turns out that's the Mellanni pillow case. Now I'm convinced. Two complaints though. First, that I order king size set and the pillowcases are king size but these pillows are standard. I wish I could buy pillowcases only. Secondly, I messaged Mellanni and they said they'd get back to me. They never  have.
title: Truly do seem to be the best I've ever had

author: Rosio Ruelas Mares
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 28, 2020
review_content: I just had to come on here and say after having these for a couple months yesterday I thought they were done for. I accidentally poured some bleach on the sheet while trying to pour some into the washer it trickled down to where this was sitting waiting to be put in the dryer. I was sad, immediately knew it would be stained, already knew I'd have to come back to this order and buy another one, but to try and salvage it I washed it off with water and threw it in the dryer and was flabbergasted to see that once dry there was no sign of bleach! I cried on the inside because I did not have to buy another set, and had to come here to tell you all about the magic this sheet contains, not sure if it was the material or maybe the bleach wasn't very strong. Whatever it may have been I am a firm believer this is the most amazing stain resistance unicorn sheet set and every household needs it! Oh and they are super soft and cozy!
title: Bleach couldn't stand a chance

author: J. L. Prescott
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 21, 2019
review_content: I washed the sheets prior to using.  They came out of the dryer soft and wrinkle free.  I don't know why but the four nights I did use the sheets, I did not sleep well at all.  I think I might have some allergy to the microfibre material.  I suggest that the top hem of the flat sheet be widened to at least 4".  There is plenty of material to do so.  The bottom sheet elastic is quite narrow and that concerns me as to how long that elastic will last.  Other than that, the sheets seem to be fine for others.  I would like to return for a refund.
title: Private to Sellers

author: MGervo
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 26, 2020
review_content: I bought these sheets because it specifically says “fits up to 16” depth” as you can see from my photo is more like 14”. That’s pretty disappointing so I will probably have to return the. As this fabric doesn’t stretch. Also the color is supposed to be sky blue and there is not one spec of blue in here - it’s all grey. Which would be live able with the price but I again I really needed the 16”.  I will update once I try them on the bed.I do like how you can buy extra pillowcases as I am always having to make more with the top sheet which I don’t use.UPDATE: although the depth is definitely off, the sheets seem to have a lot of "excess" length and width so the 2; depth differential is not an issue. HOWEVER there is a lot of "excess" length and width so the sheets fit kind of loose on the sides.. like 1980s Z. Cavaricci pants baggy.. thinking of buying some of those sheet suspenders
title: Depth is off

author: Amazonable
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 19, 2019
review_content: Picked up stains, and I do not eat or drink in my bed. I have no idea what the stains came from. Look like water spots but no drying.  I am a Male so I do not have a desire to add oils or lotions to my body so we can exclude that. It is a complete mystery.  And let me add, I just began using  them only about 1 week (I laundry 2 times each month) single, white collar and unattached with no pets) so what is causing these mysterious stains and what will I see after the first laundry is still unknown. But we can be sure about is NO, they are NOT stain Resistant.
title: Mystery Stains on Stain Resistant Sheets... wtf

author: LoganK
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 30, 2020
review_content: These had been talked up A LOT by lots of bloggers/influencers I follow, so my expectations were sky-high.  I think that's a little unfair because I really wasn't considering the great price when I initially opened the box and looked at them.  First, I made my own mistake by buying a darker color knowing I wouldn't like how it looked on my bed (that's my fault, trying to avoid obvious dirt stains on the sheets from dogs/kids).  I also just wasn't thrilled with the fitted sheet's elastic hem, it looks very cheap and there were strings hanging out all over which just seems lazy.  The top sheet doesn't have a nice design on the top hem either like the pillow cases, so that threw me off.  The pillow cases are very nice and have an extra pocket on the open side so your pillow doesn't slide out which is great and was unexpected for the price.  Overall, they're very nice and a good deal!  Just don't buy them expecting to be literally blown away, because they're pretty average in my opinion.

author: Danielle LeBoeuf
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 26, 2019
review_content: I am very picky. I spend hours researching products to make sure I know all of the pros and cons prior to purchasing. My process of buying these sheets wasn’t any different. So after about 5 hours of googling and clicking I made the decision to give them a shot. Let me tell you, I am ECSTATIC I did! Let’s look at the pros and cons:Pros:- super soft (you feel like royalty)- color consistent throughout whole sheets- no pilling thus far- fits perfectly on bed- stitching seems sturdy and able to hold up to washingCons.- stains relatively easily- the twin set only comes with 1 pillow case with no option to purchase just 1 moreI realize the pillow case might not be an issue for everyone but I like to have 2 pillows on my bed but the twin set only comes with one.Overall, I would recommend these sheets because if I didn’t love going to bed before I do now.

author: Ashley
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 4, 2019
review_content: I ordered these in white a few months ago and they were the softest sheets ever! I ordered these pinstripe white/gray ones this time and they are NOT the same sheets! The feel is completely different and not worth the price difference that is attached to the pinstripe. Completely disappointed.

author: YEAH IT'S LYNN
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 20, 2020
review_content: Y'all. These sheets are SO much better than I imagined!I was nervous buying "microfiber" because I've gotten several sheet sets in the past of that material and they felt so so cheap.These are SO SO SO soft and they absolutely do not feel cheap at all! They don't get hot either! I feel like I paid way more than $30 for these sheets. I literally wanted to cry when I had to get out of bed this morning. I wanna buy ALL the colors now😁The detail on the pillowcase is also super nice!*Update* we upgraded our bed from a queen to a king and I came back fo new mellani sheets for our new bed.
