author: Sheree Chrestman
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 26, 2019
review_content: I read from other reviews these sheets were soft so I wasn't too surprised when I received them and man are they soft and so comfortable. We have Egyptian cotton sheets that were expensive and I promise we have changed them back out for the comfort of these sheets. The cotton sheets were cold and these were just right. The other thing is my husband has thin skin that any nick he will bleed. Well he has bled on these white sheets and when we washed them (in cold water as instructed) the blood always comes out and never stains. I can't say enough great things about them except to say all three of my adult kids are receiving a set as part of their Christmas!
title: Soooo soft, all stains come right out and we have changed from Egyptian cotton to these.

author: Sammi
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 15, 2017
review_content: Ok, so these sheets are amazing and I am so angry!! Let me explain...we needed new sheets badly. So I went to Bed Bath and Beyond and spent over $100 on new 600TC sheets. I thought they were going to be amazing. We slept on them for about a week, and my husband tells me he doesn’t like them, which upset me because of how much I spent. I tell him they’re expensive sheets and he laughs at me, goes on Amazon and quickly finds these sheets for a fraction of the cost that I paid at BBB. I was NOT convinced they would be even close to as nice as the ones I bought. But oh my god, they are SOOOOO much better. I can’t believe it. They are so soft and so comfortable..thin yet durable. I am in love with them. Now, I stated earlier that they’re so nice that it makes me angry...because my husband was RIGHT! These are the best sheets ever. I can’t believe my $130 sheets from BBB are our back-up set. I will continue to buy these sheets and recommend them to family and friends.
title: Best sheets ever! Worth 3x what you pay!

author: April M
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 18, 2020
review_content: Update: Just ordered my third set. I practically gave up on my other sheets after I got my first two. Almost 6 months in and still no piling, an issue that had kept me away from microfiber for years. And they fit so well, I don't have to deal with them popping off the corners even with all my insomnia induced tossing and turning. I love the colors so much I might be back soon for my fourth set. 🤫.......................................I've only washed them twice so far but I love them so much I ordered another set. They don't over heat me like some microfiber can. Love the deep pockets. My matters is 14 inches thick. Hopefully they don't start pilling cause I might get a third set. Love the vibrant colors! Still bright after two washes hopefully it holds up.
title: Bright and comfy
verified: Size: California KingColor: Imperial BlueVerified Purchase

author: DBPom
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 28, 2019
review_content: Do you like the feeling of static cling and static electricity all over your body and hair when you’re trying to fall asleep or stay asleep? Do you like to be excessively warm when you’re trying to fall asleep or stay asleep?  Do you enjoy waking up sweating? Do you want to pull the sheet over your shoulder in the middle of the night and see sparks? Real sparks? Do you want to spend an inordinate amount of time running your fingers over the sheets in the middle of the night to see the pretty light show? Do you want to pretend that your hand is a stun gun, as you run your fingers over the sheets and see sparks and electricity shooting between your fingers?I don’t like any of those things, so I returned these sheets.In my opinion, microfiber is not an appropriate fabric for a sheet set. Cotton breathes. This stuff suffocates and ignites. No thanks.
title: Spontaneous Human Combustion Is Real

author: Amanda C.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 27, 2019
review_content: I DO NOT RECOMMEND THIS PRODUCT.  The only good thing I can say is they are soft.Now here are is the bad:1. The "deep pockets" won't fit a thick mattress.2. The elastic becomes very loose after just a few months.3. The fabric is so thin you can see through it, no joke.4. I purchased the white striped and you can barely see the lines and they are only on one side.5. My set came with oily marks (maybe from the sewing machine?) Barely visible but did not wash out.Literally one of the worst purchases I've made on Amazon. Still trying to figure out how they have over 6k positive reviews. I normally buy the cotton hotel set from Sam's club for $49 but thought I would try something different. Wish I would have paid the extra and got better quality.
title: What did I expect for $23 I guess
verified: Size: California KingColor: Striped – WhiteVerified Purchase

author: Zvezdana Kish
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 24, 2018
review_content: I like it very much! I was surprised how thin the sheets are and that the strips on the edge of the pillowcases do not carry over to the other side.... but besides that the softness and comfort of sleeping in these sheets is absolutely top notch. I have never slept in anything this cozy. I honestly think it has improved the quality of my night rest. Also, the company really stands by its product and their commitment to serve their customers. There was a small imperfection in one of the pillowcases and they were very quick to take care of the issue way beyond my expectation. I am very happy with my purchase. I suspect the thickness of the sheets will not affect durability, so the only (and for me very small) disappointment is that the strips on the edge of the pillowcases do not carry over to the other side. But that is something I will not be bothered by because I use a memory foam pillow and tend not to use both sides of the pillowcase anyway. If not for that, this product would have received 5 starts from me.Another thing good to know is that the fitted sheets are very, very deep to the point that my 13-14 inch mattress still has plenty room left for a mattress top, so the fitted sheets on my split king fit very loosely. Not sure if this will eventually become a problem with my adjustable mattress. So far, so good.
title: OH, SO SOFT....
verified: Size: Split King SetColor: BeigeVerified Purchase

author: MonaBeeReads
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 19, 2017
review_content: First wash before use as i normally do with new sheets. Loose strings galore.  Cheaply made. Poor quality. Disappointed. Didn’t try to return since I’ve washed them.
title: Poor Quality

author: Alex
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 17, 2020
review_content: I'm one of those bedding snobs that has always looked for the 'perfect' sheets. Anything from several hundred dollar high-thread count Egyptian Cotton to mid-range Cotton. The problem I've come across is that quality various DRASTICALLY between manufacturers; I've had 'high-end,' high thread count sheets that are less comfortable than off the rack mid-range 600tc sheets and anywhere in between.Being in AZ with triple digit summers, one of my biggest selling points for sheets is softness & lightweight-- that's typically a very hard line to tow as typically extremely high thread count sheets are heavy or may not be very soft.I REALLY hesitated with these sheets as I assumed being synthetic, they would retain heat & not be very breathable. While they definitely seem to retain heat more than cotton, they are by far the softest sheets I've EVER owned. They almost have a 'silky' feel to them without being too 'absorbent' like silk, or other polyester like material. Generally in the summer, I only sleep under the comforter anyway, regardless of the sheet, so that's usually not an issue. When it cools off I'll have to give them a spin for the 'real' heat test.Regarding the quality, they are extremely lightweight, EXTREMELY over-sized which makes putting on the elastic sheet/top sheet a breeze (my old sheets would only last about a week before I was fiddling to wrap them around the mattress again) and do seem to 'stain' fairly easy. While stains wash out fine, I noticed they really soak up sweat/spills. I don't think these will be sheets you can sleep in every day for years, but with the cost being a 1/3 of most high quality sheets, I'll probably end up with a couple sets anyway for 'accidents' or otherwise.Overall I think I'm a convert over Egyptian Cotton, primarily in that the quality seems to be ALL over the place with cotton regardless of the tc. While I can already tell these aren't the 'lightest' sheets around, unless you're a heavy night sweater I'd imagine you'd be fine; and this is coming from a big guy who runs like a furnace.
title: Bedding 'snob' that's a microfiber convert!

author: Anthony
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 23, 2020
review_content: Follow up to my review:After contacting the supplier, they were very responsive.  Customer service is outstanding and they have already ordered new pillow cases to be delivered.  Without said, I've changed my rating from 1 to 4.  They really stand behind their product!At first I was pleased with the sheets, but thought I'd run them through a quick wash before using them for the first time.  Unfortunately both pillow cases came apart at the seams.  Not very happy right now!
title: Nice sheets if they'd stay together...
verified: Size: Split King SetColor: BurgundyVerified Purchase

author: Costa Rica Fam
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 14, 2020
review_content: This product falls apart. We were so hopeful but these sheets are not worth it. Within a week, our pillow cases had holes in them (our last sheet set lasted more than 5 years). Figuring this was a fluke, we requested a replacement. The next set did the same thing within another week. They are also sloppy on the bed after sleeping in them the first night and the edge droops off really long on the non-hallway visible side (so one side can look nice). These are not worth buying. It is worth paying more. They have to last longer than this and I don't love that the bed always felt sloppy.
title: Falls Apart, Doesn't Fit Well

author: G&K
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 26, 2016
review_content: LOVE LOVE LOVED these sheets!  I got the navy blue pattern & they are the prettiest sheets I have ever owned.  They wash well, they fit on our deep mattress well & the price is great!  I love them so much, I am buying another set!UPDATE: Over the years we've own 2 sets & loved them. But just bought another set & they aren't nearly the same quality. They used to be soft & thick & after a few years of use, only slight wear. The new sheets are thin, see through & slippery & have already developed a pilly feel after only one wash. Bummed...won't buy again.  Washed again & even worse, so pilly that it is impossible to sleep.  I've contacted the seller as they claim to give refunds, no questions asked, so hopefully I can get my money back & move back cotton sheets, I'm done with microfiber & tired of the bait & switch that is so common nowadays.UPDATE #2 - the seller did give me a refund & suggested I try the solid colors instead of the pattern.  I won't as I loved the pattern & the original 2 pairs of sheets I've ordered over the past 3 years.  I was so happy with those, I think that is why I feel so jaded after this transaction.
title: Went from best to worst. Not the same sheets - SO SAD
verified: Size: California KingColor: Quatrefoil Navy BlueVerified Purchase

author: Stephanie Merrick
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 13, 2019
review_content: I have bought several sets of these sheets now for both queen and twin beds. The sheets are excellent and I recommend them to everyone! They are so soft after several washes and months of use and the price is extremely reasonable. I’d normally give 5 stars, but sad to say I can’t.I’ve never had a negative experience until recently. I bought two sets of white twin XL sheets. When I opened them, they seemed to have a purplish tint to them, as if they were washed in a load with a purple sock. I thought maybe it was the lighting in my laundry room, so I washed them thinking it was nothing. It turns out they are off in color. I returned them and got two new sets. I got my new sets two days later, and I can see through the packaging that one is white as expected, and the other has the same purple hue as the first two sets I got. Now I have a third set to return, and hopefully they’ll accept it without issue because I don’t have the packaging for the first two sets I bought. I’m hoping the return goes smoothly and I can get my second set in the white color I need! I’ll update this review as soon as I get the returns completed.
title: Great sheets! Be sure to check the color before washing!

author: MMJ
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 13, 2020
review_content: I purchased these sheets in late March and started using them right in the beginning of April. It's now just the beginning of May, about a month and a week later and the middle of the she right where your stomach and hips may be is completely stained with this weird yellow-gray tint. I don't know where it's from but I guessed possibly just sweat. Even though I have a fan directly on me and I wear full body pajamas, I thought to myself No problem then, I go to wash the sheets put tons of OxiClean and stain remover and the stains won't come out. Not only did they stain very fast after normal washing every two weeks, and actually more because I noticed the yellow grayish tint about a week and a half after and washed it then, but they will not come out and it just seems to get worse. If it wasn't for this I would give it five stars but now it looks like my bed is disgusting. What's worse is that I brought another pair of sheets and I think I'm going to return them because I don't want the same thing to happen. Very disappointed especially after all of the positive reviews.

author: James Papeika
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 13, 2019
review_content: My wife and I were looking to replace old cooling/moisture wicking sheets without spending hundreds.  My wife (who is always cold) said they she can’t sleep another night on these sheets because of the heat.  I agree—and we are out shopping for sheets as I write this review. I joked that they feel like a frying pan. Of course, all of this is subjective, but compared to the other sheets we had the difference is remarkable. I would return these if we hadn’t just passed the 30 day mark.I assume this is because the material is not cotton—if you climb into bed in the dark, you will see a static-electricity light show.I did however give two stars because the material feels nice overall.  I think I still prefer cotton, but these sheets appear crisp and feeel very smooth.

author: N.S

review_content: After reading reviews about these sheets and recognizing there is a cult following for them, I decided to give them a shot. Well, as crazy as it may seem, the internet is right and these sheets are the best. They are the softest out there. Also, just to be real with you all, I got blood on the sheets and thought I ruined them but they only cost like $25 so I don’t feel so bad. review_content: These sheets are really soft and smooth and thin. Nice for summer. But I do like my better sheets. But its nice to have back ups. verified: Size: KingColor: Striped – Gray / SilverVerified Purchase

author: Yabbadabbadoo
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 2, 2020
review_content: So very vibrant in color, and oh so soft!!!  I bought a set in Gold in 2015.....and searched for Coral/deep peach recently, my favorite color, and found it here!!!  On a lightning deal one day by surprise!!!  So....I got the Coral I have been wanting for a long time, AND, got the hot pink too!!!!  Both lightning deals! Truly made my day!The fitted sheet has elastic all around, love that, but yes, it is NOT a tight tight fit, and I actually like that, because if it were tight, many times the corners get unsewn from putting the fitted sheet on!! author: audone
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 28, 2020
review_content: I bought these sheets mainly because of the good reviews and thinking I would try something different than my usual 100% Egyptian cotton, which can be expensive and not as durable as a mixed blend.  Big mistake.  This was my first(and last) try with microfiber sheets and I am not a fan. These sheets are soft, I will give them that, and comfortable enough. However they are very cloying and tend to feel like they are sticking to your skin if you get even a little bit warm.  They lasted less than a week on our bed because  you can feel these sheets holding the heat in, even though they are pretty thin.  Definitely not breathable like all cotton is.The quality was okay, and I guess if you like microfiber, they would be nice. But if you are used to crisp cotton and enjoy that feel, you will likely not appreciate these sheets.  I put them away and will see how they are next winter, but for now, back to cotton.
title: Not sheets for summer

author: Rebecca H.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 7, 2020
review_content: Finally, I finally found a sheet set I cannot live without!  Every night when getting in to bed I feel like I am at a quality  hotel. I cannot explain these sheets other than high quality!  They fit my King mattress very well, no slipping off the corners!  They did have a chemical-type smell upon opening them but I washed them right away and the smell has disappeared. They were a tad wrinkled when out of the dryer but after putting the sheets and pillow cases on, you would never know there was a wrinkle. Honestly, for the price I paid I was not expecting such a quality sheet set. I will be buying more and if the sheets continue to hold up well, probably will be a customer for life!

author: Whiskey Tango Foxtrot
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 23, 2018
review_content: When I bought these, I didn't trust the reviews. For the record, I paid full price for these, didn't get a refund, discount, wasn't contacted by the seller, etc etc.I've had these sheets now for about 2 months and they are the softest sheets I've ever owned. That on its own isn't that impressive, but combined with how strong they apparently are (I go through sheets like crazy because I spoil my golden retriever and let her sleep in bed, and she likes to scratch at the bedding before lying down). To date, not so much as a single tear.I got the gold sheets and so far after 4 washings there is no color fade or loose threads.

author: Heather Lucero
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 29, 2020
review_content: There are certainly pros and cons with these sheets, so first, let’s go with the pros which ultimately resulted in the 5 stars I left them. For a high thread count, they are amazing! They’re soft, they keep me warm and the finish and color look amazing. I was very surprised when I received them and they were so soft. By far the best sheets I have ever purchased yet. The cons, I have cats, one of my cats uses her claws to jump on my bed as my bed is higher and she is rather old. You can see all the claw marks by the thread fray she’s caused. However, this happens with my pants and shirts also should my cats knead while laying on me. It’s hard to find material that’s “cat claw proof.” Remember when I said they keep me warm, that’s going to be awesome during the winter, but in the summer heat at night, it was a little bothersome. Haven’t had them long enough to experience winter with them, but I am excited for the warmth to come! I know they’ll do a great job. They wash well, not much shrinking and they slightly wrinkle. I don’t care much for the flap on the pillow cases. Not sure what their function is as of yet and it makes the pillows look a little odd if that flap isn’t pressed after watching them. Overall I rate 5 stars for the quality you get for the price. I love how soft they are and I am literally excited to go to bed and cozy up with them. The color options were amazing and I went with the teal green.
title: Soft and comfy! Just my style!

author: K T
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2018
review_content: The bad reviews were very bad. Like holes in the sheets etc.  The good reviews were fantastic.  These linens belong to the good reviews. The customer service and communication is top notch.  Shipping was very fast and the product is exceptional.  No smells that new sheets have. Good packaging as described and no issues with washing them.  What they don't say is that they are deep pocket sheets. I have a 16" thick king size temperpedic and it fits so well it doesn't shift on the bed or loosen up causing wrinkles.  They are soft and stay cool and breath very well.  What else could I want in a nice looking affordable set of sheets.
title: Ignore the negative reviews and buy with confidence
verified: Size: KingColor: Striped – Gray / SilverVerified Purchase

author: Traci
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 20, 2020
review_content: My daughter has 5 sets in her house and highly recommended them. I read a lot of reviews and decided to try them. I have always been a fan of 100% cotton sateen but lately its hard to find a quality product that doesn't leave a ton of lint on us or the other laundry. These sheets are nice. A little less slippery than i like,  but they stay in place and don't come untucked. The pillows stay in the pillowcases and they wash great and NO LINT. I immediately ordered a second set in another color and gave away a set I had just spent $60 on. Btw the colors are true to the pictures. I was pleased with both.We travel in our rv so the temps can change quickly and cotton gets sweaty in the heat. It's hot where we are now and these sheets still feel great.
title: Nice. Worth the price.

author: GracysMom
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2019
review_content: You get less than you pay for with these sheets! And, that’s highly disappointing with the reviews I read and considered prior to purchasing this set. When I first opened the package I was impressed with the softness and texture of this set. Then my excitement over having what I believed a new and comfortable set of sheets quickly turned to pure disappointment!  As you will see by the attached pictures, the fitted sheet has a VERY LONG flaw which stretches half-way across the entire sheet. So, buyers BEWARE! Unless you want to take the chance on having to return your order, you may want to consider a different selection and save yourself this headache.
title: You Get Less Than You Pay For!

author: Debra I.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 19, 2020
review_content: If you have a thick mattress and your corners don't usually stay, you will NOT have that problem with these sheets.  They are very deep, we have a very thick mattress and the sheets fit it great.  The only thing that I am kind of disappointed in is the bottom sheet is almost too large.  If you like a tight fit, you may need to tuck your bottom sheet everyday.I love the softness, overall for the cost of these sheets, you cannot go wrong.  I will be purchasing these sheets from now on.  They are absolutely worth the money.  Of note, I almost did not buy because I read a review about them being poor quality, stained, and really thin.  I don't know what the issue was with that individuals purchase; however I can say it could not be farther from the truth.  These arrived very clean and in new packaging the fabric was not thin, worn, or otherwise of poor quality.I am very happy I chose to give these a try.  I LOVE these sheets!!!!
title: Very Comfortable Sheets

author: LuLu
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 13, 2020
review_content: I’m recovering from spinal fusion surgery so I spend most of my day in bed. I needed new sheets that were colorful to inspire me because I’m a college student and being in bed so much can be very depressing so I did a lot of research on bedding and I’m so happy I purchased these sheets. I LOVE them! I purchased the lavender, royal blue and persimmon (Orange) colors to compliment my boho duvet set. The colors are so vivid and will cheer your bedroom up beautifully! The quality is spot on and I plan to use cold water when I wash each set individually and air dry to maintain them for years to come. Great purchase, fast delivery and excellent quality! You may find less expensive microfiber sheets but unless they are 1800 count which these are you will be disappointed. Don’t hesitate!. Get these sheets from this seller!
title: Soft, luxurious with an excellent pop of color!

author: Trisha of California
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 16, 2020
review_content: OMG.  Like the other 10,000+ reviews these sheets are incredible.  I have purchased these about 4 times......for different beds.  They are very soft.  They are also what I would call thin sheets but I like that.  They are not heavy in weight and because of that, they almost feel cool.  I have only bought the white ones so can’t comment on the colors offered.  I don’t expect them to last years and years with everyday use,  not realistic with the lightness of the fabric but for the price, these cannot be beat.
title: Love these sheet sets!

author: Denise
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 9, 2020
review_content: First off, I ordered these because of all the great reviews!I washed them in recommended cold water before I put them on my bed.  I had to sew them before I could make my bed!!!!!!  I would have returned them, but it was all I had.  I had already thrown my old sheets away.The elastic on the fitted sheet was coming out.  I had to take a needle and thread and “fix” it.  Don’t know how long it will last and if other areas start coming apart.Time will tell how long these sheets will last.  With only one washing I can’t really tell yet.My husband does not like them.  They “slide” around a lot.  They are not cotton like what we’re used to.  They’re like a polyester.Won’t be buying them again.  I will go back to my Target Threshold sheets!
title: My set was not great!

author: Critter Queen
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 24, 2020
review_content: After all the hype I had to try. Don't really get the hype unless there's lots of false reviews. After all the number is crazy high!Pros:Price point! (May explain those cons below!)Color optionsSoft smooth feelClean (fancy touch) packaging in pic 1-3Speedy deliveryCons:(*knowledgeable sewer & laundry expert here)Dirty spots! Oil does not wash out! Pic 4Flat sheet cut on bias...the top band is twisted & will never lay correct. Pic 5Decorative trim is only on one side of the pillowcases! Never seen this before! The twisted top is what shows when you pull down the bedding! Not acceptable!Opposite side of the pillowcases is not even sewn down but an open gapping flap. Bizarre!They are not "Made in America" but according to the label inspected here. *Pretty sure they should open each when inspecting because they missed some quality control issues!
title: Eh... Issues vs Price

author: John D.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 5, 2017
review_content: This is our third Mellanni bed set we've purchased over the last few years. We have tried several of the similar brushed microfiber sets from other brands with competitive prices. So far, Mellanni is a cut above the rest! In fact we purchased 2 different sets for the same price during the Black Friday sales week. One Mellanni set, and one Utopia Bedding set. Normally the Mellanni is just a few $ more than the Utopia, and in all honesty Its worth paying that extra couple $. The Utopia isnt bad, but the Mellanni just feels like it's significantly superior in quality. Its thicker than the Utopia. By comparison it feels like a more expensive sheet with higher thread count. The Utopia is soft, but the Mellanni is even softer! It feels like other sheets that we've paid 2-3x the price for in department stores! Soft is really important for me. Trying to sleep on any sort of rough-feeling fabrics is a nightmare for me. I have a pretty severe case of Fibromyalgia (amongst other health issues) and I suffer from roaming nerve pain and skin sensitivity. Sleeping on rough fabrics can cause parts of my body to feel like they have really bad sunburn or road rash. Its awful! These sheets have been wonderful! They're so silky soft to the touch, but not slippery like silk or satin sheets.For the price, you really can't go wrong!  My wife and I have bought similarly priced sheet sets in Walmart that were nowhere near this soft, comfortable or durable for that matter! They dont offer nearly as many color options either. Our original Mellanni set from several years ago is still like new. No color-fading, loose threads, rips or tears. Bought a set for my Grandmother too and she absolutely loves em. We will definitely buy more from them in the future! Their customer service has also been really friendly and they've gone that extra mile to make sure we were satisfied with our purchase.
title: Soft, comfortable. An excellent bed set for the price! Can't go wrong!

author: Lattez
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 26, 2020
review_content: I decided not to put review until two years later.Now it's time.What did I buy?- Paisley Blue mattress to match with a Pinewood bed frame (IKEA-Tarva). I thought the bedsheet pattern and pinewood would match to give the look and feel of seaside calmness. I am not disappointed at all.How was it after two years? (This is based on the product description.)- No torn part---- I've occasionally cleaned the bedsheet, but the pillowcase sheet is being machine washed 1-2 times every month. The pillowcase is not torn at all.- Wrinkle resistant?---- It is to me.- Comfort---- TBH, there are so many factors such as a mattress, pillow, etc, resulting in this. With this combination, I am happy with it.--IMPORTANT QUESTION--Would I buy it again myself?----- Yes! The price is really worth for me, and it provides the design that I like.
title: After 2+ years of using it...

author: CruiseReview
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2019
review_content: A friend suggested these for me, and I’ll NEVER buy anything but these moving forward. They’re SO soft! I’ve spent over $100 on Egyptian Cotton sheets and every thing in between. These are by FAR the soctest, most comfortable sheets I’ve owned. They have deep pockets and hold up well when washing. Because of the microfiber, I would suggest washing alone (no towels or anything) to prevent picking. I’ve had mine for over a year and they’re still in excellent condition—no wash wear, picking, or loose threads!
title: Only Sheets You’ll Ever Buy!

author: Kathy E. Mudroch
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 12, 2020
review_content: I have purchased Mellani sheets in the past, and absolutely loved them. They are soft, comfortable, wrinkle-resistant, and colorfast. I purchased the burgundy color sheets to match a quilt that I recently purchased. Right out of the package, the color was gorgeous. I washed the new sheets on the bedding setting (warm water, cold water rinse, low spin). I put a Color Catcher in the washer, to check to see how badly the burgundy color ran (as reds can do). What went in as a beautiful burgundy, came out as a muted rust color. In the dryer, I put in dryer balls, as I usually do, to help the sheets dry faster, without static. When the dryer stopped, the white dryer balls were red. I am worried about putting these sheets on my bed, as the color will  probably rub off on everything it touches. I will rewash the sheets before putting them on my bed. If the color is still bleeding, it will not be used.This review is about the burgundy colored sheets only. The other Mellani sheets I have ordered do not have this issue (lite blue, purple, lavendar, and navy). I do not recommend purchasing the burgundy sheets.
title: Beautiful Burgundy Sheets Turned Into Muted Rust Sheets with 1 Wash

author: Jos
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 31, 2019
review_content: Pros1. The color was accurate. I ordered white and got white2. The sheets are soft.Cons (in order of bad to worst)1. The pillow cases have a nice decorative detail one one edge but the flat sheet doesn’t have that detail on the top edge. It’s a very plain edge that makes the sheet look very cheap and it appears as though the sheet is not from the same set as the pillow cases.2. The flap that was designed to keep the pillow case on the pillow just flaps open. It doesn’t really hold the pillow.3. Pilling: both pillow cases have pilled a lot. The fitted sheet has pilled a little.4. These sheets really build up static electricity. Every time I dress or undress the bed I get shocked multiple times.5. The worst con: these sheets are extremely hot! I have had to reduce the ac temp at night by a few degrees and point the fan directly at the bed and im still hot. I never had that problem before using these sheets.ConclusionI hate these sheets.Since buying these sheets and experiencing many uncomfortable nights, I’ve done more research on different materials and come to the conclusion that I will never buy microfiber sheets again. I will stick to natural materials from now on.
title: Worst sheets I’ve ever owned

author: Debbie Scannapieco
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 4, 2018
review_content: I don't quite understand it as I ordered four sets of these sheets in four different colors I have only set up two beds so far for a future rental property. The green set was wonderful I put this set on my bed very pleased so far super soft well made. I have not washed them yet. But so far so good...As for the purple set I made up a bed today it's like night and day they seem like a completely different sheet I will send back not nearly as soft, loose stitching falling apart along the Hem line. The pillows (standard size) barely fit the pillows. Very unhappy with this set. I am just confused as to why the green ones were so nice and the purple so inferior????
title: Will return..........

author: NGraham
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 12, 2018
review_content: I purchased these sheets in king size, white.I am happy with the feel of these sheets. Some reviews mentioned they were silky which concerned me. My quirk is that I do not like the feel of silk or satin. It just creeps me out and gives me goosebumps to touch it. I said it was a quirk!! But while the texture of these sheets is very smooth, it is not like silk or satin. I really like the smooth cotton like texture so I am very happy with that.What I am disappointed in is that the fitted sheet is not deep enough for my 17" mattress. There is not enough material to be able to tuck in the sides which results in the sheets lifting up enough to form a bit of a puddle on the top of the bed after sleeping on them each night. They don't pop off, but without being able to tuck the fitted sheet in they don't stay crisp and neat and require adjusting each day. I did notice a thread had snagged after washing (3rd time) them  but it has not caused a problem so far.I think I would be very happy with them if there was enough material so that I could tuck them in. I once had a pair of sheets that had mesh knit type sides and they were great but I have never found anything like them again. I will keep looking for sheets that work well on our bed but the next time I am mattress shopping I will definitely opt for a thinner mattress, it shouldn't be so hard to pick out sheets.
title: Nice, but not for deep enough for 17" mattresses.

author: Kim Adams
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 8, 2020
review_content: The number of high reviews got me to try these sheets. I want to like them, but I don't. They're not very nice, not made from quality material, and not finished with any care. They feel cheap and look cheap (material is so thin it's  see through). Got them yesterday, washed them, put them on my bed. I'll take them off before bed tonight and never use them again.These sheets are made from flimsy material that doesn't breathe, fails on all aesthetics.On the upside, they are deep...
title: Not a quality sheet set.
verified: Size: EXTRA DEEP pocket - QueenColor: WhiteVerified Purchase

author: Kasey
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 27, 2020
review_content: Bought these because we needed new sheets and quarantine restricted me from doing a typical TJMAXX/Homegoods run to feel and purchase sheets. Big mistake. When I got these, I could tell they were not for me. I either like a sturdy cotton sheet or a stretchy breathable feel—these were neither. Thin, wrinkled and saggy, I didn’t even finish making my bed before taking these off and returning them.They are artificial feeling. Not luxurious in any sense. Maybe I’m a snob, but I’d rather sleep on $20 sheets from Target than these any day.
title: I hated these.

author: Michelle Hodges
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 14, 2020
review_content: Oh my gosh! I usually do not rave about products but these sheets are AMAZING. They are super soft! They are also so much thicker and better quality than other sheets we have purchased! We used to spend way more than we should have on sheets, buying at least 800 thread count, making sure they were not going to start breaking down in the wash, however, these (at somewhere around $24 I think I paid), are better because they aren't as stiff, and feel like they will be around for a while! My husband had a small cut on his arm and I just about died because he left a blood spot of about a quarter-size on the sheets the second day we had them (THEY ARE WHITE)... I put laundry detergent directly on the spot and rubbed it while the washer was filling up and then threw it in, hoping for the best...took them out of the wash when it was finished and the spot was COMPLETELY GONE!!! Yes, LOVE these sheets! Sent some to my son also!
title: LOVE LOVE LOVE these sheets and pillowcases!!!

author: CM
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 1, 2020
review_content: I bought these after seeing a Buzzfeed review and reading reviews from other buyers on Amazon. I should have read the Q&As and specs, though, as I missed that these sheets are made of microfiber, which is a high grade acrylic.They look great, but I'm not a fan of the texture. My biggest issue is that they are not as cool to the touch as plant-based fibers (e.g., bamboo). Another buyer mentioned that they feel more like flannel than a slippery fabric, and I agree, which is not helpful in warm weather. We live in warm weather (>80F) for most of the year, so we'll have limited use of these.Microfiber tends to wear well, so these will likely last a while without pilling. Also, not using them for most of the year will also extend their life, so that's a bonus?
title: Microfiber = Acrylic - not the texture I wanted
verified: Size: California KingColor: Royal BlueVerified Purchase

author: LexiOCD
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 1, 2018
review_content: Wow! Really. I’ve ordered Microfiber sheets in the past and ended up Makin curtains with the babric, great then for curtains and I didn’t want to throw them away as they would NOT stay on the bed and they were hot.⭐️FAST FORWARD TO NOW! They have come a LONG way since the beginnings of Microfiber, I thought I would take a chance on buying these due to the thread coins and description (lol and I could use new curtains! ) NO! Won’t make curtains! These sheets FEEL very very good! Almost a Bamboo feel to them I thought. Light and airy not heavy as the High thread count cotton sheets like 100 TC & above, which I have but never use as the weight is just too much. Yes lol I’m a bit OCD about my sheets, and a bit of a snob I suppose , in the sheet department so I do feel qualified to write a review yes ..:)If you have had the same Expedia’s myself, well I wouldn’t presume and promise you will love these but in my case I was very pleasantly surprised! I was in a pinch and needed (RIGHT!) Purple Sheets asap! There were no cotton ones available SO thought I would take a chance for this price. Great price for this nice of a sheet set! Also, the pillow cases feel very nice on your skin, not rough of hot. We are possibly in the middle of one of THE worst heat waves we have ever had in the High desert of CA and have never had high humidity like this ever and oh SO never for this extended amount of time. I’ve had these on the bed the entire time and never felt they were a problem as far as temp goes.... this heat has put them to the test for sure! NOW I know why I hear complaint RE: Himidity from people in those prone to this “Wet” air! UGH! I must say I feel for y’all out there who deal with it all the time!Ok so I’ll stop the RANT (Mini Rant) ... and say, if your on that fence ? Go ahead and jump and try these! You MAY be surprised as I am (Was) I’m sure if I order Microfiber sheets again I’ll make certain they are this brand and this TC...... I’m sure it makes a difference AND NO not co scantly pulling the corners of bottom sheet on twice a day! (Those aggravated my spouse as much or MORE than myself! ) I guess he has been spoiled the past several years by this “Sheet Snob!) I created another! LoL no don’t need his aggravation either! He’s liking them also! I didn’t tell him I had Purchace’s Microfiber again, NO! I just mentioned to him I wondered if he noticed we had new sheets? He said,” Oh yeah, how could I miss we now have Purple? lol ) yes he was laughing and did he liked them yes. SO he still doesn’t know! Haha! I TRY and keep his complaints far and few between, would never want to listen to his complaining of the original Microfiber, heat and those corners !SO! There ya have it ! 4stars ONLY BC they aren’t my very FAV cotton sheets , sateen finish and 400 TC.... few and far between to find these days and for sure NOT in the Dang Purple LoL !!!!I hope you like them!
title: Not Yestersays Microfiber Sheets! NO!

author: Dulce de Ariz
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 13, 2020
review_content: I really liked the texture, softness, wrinkle-free and beautiful salmon color but these sheets are super itchy.  I don’t understand why we are having an allergic reaction to them as we have other polyester blend sheets.  I’ve tried washing them  8 times and we still have to take them off our bed because we can’t sleep as our skins itches horribly.  Too bad because I really liked them and now I’ll end up donating them.  They are made in China so obviously there is something off about the material used that may be causing this.
title: Pretty sheets but very itchy

author: mips
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 11, 2019
review_content: These are soft sheets, but they are very, very thin. If you hold up to the light you can see right through them. The weight feels like that of old sheets that have been washed for years, and you take up to your cabin because they're not really nice enough to have at home anymore.  The word "flimsy" comes to mind. The stitching looks like something I might have done myself on a sewing machine with a fairly loose stitch setting, so they pucker.They are not bad sheets, they just aren't the nice quality I wanted for my guest bedroom.  I struggled with the "light weight" rating. They are TOO light weight for my liking (which no doubt makes them see through).Having said that, if you have someone who is ill and even sheets on their body make them uncomfortable, these might be just what you want. Yeah, they're that lightweight.
title: They are soft, BUT . . .

author: Ashley Perkins
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 29, 2019
review_content: These are by far the best pair a sheets I have ever had! I even went to Marshall's to see if I could find something similar to what I found on Amazon. Only I saw was from Tommy Hilfiger and they were only 800 thread count for the same price. So I decided to just go ahead and order this set! I'm so happy I did! My husband and I love the set! He's already asked me to order more! And for the price and the comfort you get for this set is amazing! The are soooo soft and cool! I don't wake up in the middle of the night sweating my....yeah you know! Definitely going to order us another set...or two 😁!
title: Best set of sheets! Best price!
verified: Size: KingColor: Striped – Gray / SilverVerified Purchase

author: Anthony
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 29, 2019
review_content: We have had these sheets for 2 years (as of this month) and they have truly stood the test of time.When we purchased these, our expectations were not high.  I'm pretty sure we even bought these on sale.  We now have two sets.They are super soft, haven't ripped or had loose threads and the elastic is still in tact.  They fit our queen bed very well, and have ample room for a taller mattress (like if you have a pillow top or added pad).  The pillow cases are big enough to fit larger pillows than the standard size.  We both have the foam "My Pillow" which is very thick.We wash our sheets a couple times a month.  We use that free & gentle detergent and just regular tide dryer sheets.They look just like the day we bought them!I want to note however that they are very thin.  I appreciate that they are on the thin side, as I easily overheat at night.  And since these are polyester rather than cotton, it collects heat much easier.  When we first got these, I was concerned that the thinness would make them easily torn up, as we have a cat who sometimes scratches on our bed while stretching.  No holes yet!Good job, Mellanni!
title: Who knew $20-$30 sheets would be so rad?

author: Mama Re-Re
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 21, 2018
review_content: We finally made the upgrade from our old queen to a king sized mattress.  I was sad to have to give up my old set of microfiber sheets because they were the softest things I've ever slept on so I went on the hunt for a similar set.  When the Dark Grey Mellanni sheets arrived I was surprised to see that they were already softer than anticipated, straight from the package.  I was a little upset to see the top of the sheets didn't have the same "piping" design as the pillow cases, which I had expected.  Honestly though, for the price they're an amazing set of sheets and we couldn't be happier. If they're anything like the last set we owned then they'll only get softer and softer as time goes on.
title: I was sad to have to give up my old set of ...

author: Emily
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 16, 2020
review_content: These are really classy, durable and soft sheets that wash and dry well. If you want to hand wash and hang dry that works well for these sheets too. Just make sure to follow the manufacturer's care and washing instructions and you will be fine. I love the gray color because it is a neutral and goes with a lot. When this current set wears out, I might get the beige or navy. I might go for a funky color. There are quality options at affordable prices online now and I am so grateful and mindful of that. I hope this helps. I highly recommend this product.I was not compensated in any way for this review. I like to give open, honest and transparent feedback on products I like to try. I hope you found this review to be helpful. If so, please click the 'Helpful' button to let myself and others know that it has helped you.
title: Soft Sheets

author: Optiman36
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 3, 2018
review_content: Fit was very loose, even after washing and drying per directions. Sheets were plenty soft, even when wrinkled it was hard to notice because the softness blended with the thin material did not build up an uncomfortable wrinkle, the sheets just had a very poor and loose fit. Corners were too long and would not fit tight at all, see picture. They seemed to be cut too long, and the elastic band was more for looks than the function of keeping the sheets tight. I contacted the company and they cheerfully agreed to send another set of sheets at no charge, and told us to keep the first set. Good company, just a chance poor sewn fitted sheet I suspect.
title: Company agreed to send another set because of the defective ones received

author: Timothy Madsen
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 17, 2019
review_content: We use these on our five beds in our vacation rental properties and get such rave reviews from our guests. Thank you to Bless 'er House and Lauren: Best find ever! I purchased these in beige stripe for the king but added a mocha. I ordered teal and peach for the sofa sleepers. I find that the fine thread in the micro fiber has a bit more static in our area which attracts pet hair and link. I have tried fabric softener to reduce the static, also tried to not completely drying the sheets to reduce static cling. The dryer sheets so far tend to leave a patchy residue on the sheets. I need to fold the sheets or put them back on the bed as soon as I remove them from the dryer to reduce wrinkling. Overall, a great product.
title: Loads of compliments on the "soft hand" feeling

author: Casey K
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 30, 2018
review_content: TL;DR: Soft if that's what you're into, not quite true to color, but in a good wayI ordered the Spa Mint color and I'm really happy with it. I think they look Sage-y in the picture, but they do have a mintier tint in person. They're light, though, and I would still consider them a neutral. It's a prettier color than in the picture, but I couldn't capture well in the lighting I've got in a picture. They're really nice soft sheets and seems like they'll hold up well. Personally, I prefer a stiffer, less soft sheet, but my husband loves these and doesn't like my 'scratchy' cotton ones. I do find that these sleep warmer, and that they're a bit harder to move on, than cotton sheet, mainly because they're more 'grabby' on the surface. I also personally think they get clingier and static-y-er than cotton sheets, but that's up for debate. They've got a really smooth and soft feeling, but they do go on more like cotton sheets in that they don't stretch. Example: jersey sheets are soft, but they're stretchy soft material. These are a non-elastic-y material that just have a soft finish, which makes them stay better than, say, jersey sheets. The actual packaging the sheets are in looks a bit dated, but the sheets have a really classic style with the lines on the top hem. I don't generally fold back my sheet to show it, but these look nice enough I could.
title: Super soft sheets

author: Jaz L.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 13, 2020
review_content: I am very impressed with these sheets so far.  I got them a month ago and they have gone through the wash at least 4 times. They stayed soft and wrinkle free. I did receive them with one small smudge on the hem and it will not wash out this is unfortunate but not a deal breaker. The fitted sheet is deep so there is a little extra room.  The pillow cases do have the inside pocket to fold the entire pillow inside the case. You can buy extra pillow cases in varying sizes and colors and although not the same low price as the sheet set they are not unfair. I got the yellow and it was brighter and felt warmer then the image online but I really liked it. I came across this product from the Good House Keeping review site and it was listed as best value. I also saw that a previous review stated if the bed is against the wall not to get a dark color cause it will stain a light colored wall. I went ahead and ordered another set.
title: Great price and very soft.

author: Alli
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 14, 2020
review_content: My favorite thing about these sheets is that they are truly soft. Least favorite thing, is that because they are synthetic (it seems polyester), they retain any odors much more than natural fibers like cotton or wool.PROS:- softness: 10/10. I actually love crawling into bed with these sheets. So comfy!-fit: I have a thick mattress topper, and these sheets accommodate that topper and are fairly easy to stretch over my queen mattress.CONS:- odors: While I am someone who doesn’t get “BO” (I have never had to wear deodorant), I do however have skin that is more oily than average. These sheets, due to their synthetic nature, absorb oils and hence emit an odor, despite me washing them once a week.  Natural fibers like cotton or wool, absorb moisture rather than odor-emitting oils. If you have drier skin, you might be okay with these sheets.- temperature: these sheets DO NOT keep you cool. I am someone who is usually sleeps cold and needs an electric blanket, but have woken up numerous times in a full sweat with these sheetsOverall, I’d say love the feel but otherwise, not my fave.
title: Soft but absorb odors

author: C. Shaw
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 29, 2020
review_content: In my quest to find the perfect sheets, I looked on Good Housekeeping and these were the #1 budget pick. They are so soft. I love them. I can’t say how long they will last as I’ve only had them a week. I washed them of course before putting them on the bed and they came out of the dryer just fine. I plan to order several sets of these for every bedroom in my house. P.s. I have a texture sensitivity and most sheets feel scratchy but these are wonderful. I have bought expensive sheets from Macy’s, etc. but, none were this soft.
title: The Softest Sheets. Ever.

author: Jodie
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 1, 2020
review_content: I have paid a ton of money trying to find the best sheets. From cheap Walmart sheets to high end Egyptian cotton. These are by far the softest and most comfortable sheets I have ever slept on. They are very light weight so you don't feel smothered, yet they keep you plenty warm when it's cold and cool when it's hot. I  loved them so much I took all my old sheets and put them in my spare bedrooms and bought another set in a different color for my room. Would highly recommend these sheets
title: Great Sheets

author: Brittany
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 19, 2019
review_content: There’s no way that most of these reviews aren’t paid for. These sheets are just horrible. They’re like a firm tissue paper. SO thin, not soft at all, and the feel is exactly like tissue paper that you use to wrap present. I was so disappointed given all the great reviews so I washed them once on regular, once on hot, once with a ton of fabric softener....no change. They are terrible. Buyer beware.
title: The good reviews have to be paid-for, buyer beware
verified: Size: California KingColor: Quatrefoil Silver - GrayVerified Purchase

author: Alyx
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 2, 2019
review_content: These sheets are very soft and comfortable for their price! They fit our 12” king mattress  well, and the color was exactly the same as the picture. They aren’t as soft abs my bamboo sheets, but that’s to be expected since it’s a microfiber blend.However, there are a couple of minor issues... for one, one side of the sheets has an odd, spotted discoloration. The spots are dark orange, which is quite noticeable against the persimmon color of the sheets. Second, these did not come out of my dryer wrinkle-free, but the packaging says no to iron them. I don’t mind that much, but it is frustrating when it’s sold as one thing but turns out to be another.Overall, these are decent for what you pay, but they’ll probably be my “spare” sheets for when it’s laundry day, or I’ll use them on the guest bed.
title: Excellent for the price, not as good as the description says

author: The Old Guy Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 16, 2018
review_content: I bought this sett of sheets and I also bout a $149 dollar set to compare quality and if its worth the high cost of those other sets or if these sheets would do the job.These sheets feel great and soft like a t-shirt.  The are comfortable and I will have to see how the durability is but so far I am happy with the product.The difference I've notice so far between these and those $149 ones is the expensive sheets weigh about 5 times as much as these do.  The high dollar ones wrinkled pretty bad when I washed them and these didn't.  These sheets are softer than the expensive sheets as well.So,  Which sheets will I buy next time?  I believe I'll buy these again.  Actually,  I'll buy these several more times which I can before I come close to buying $149 sheets again.
title: Soft like a T-Shirt and Good Product for the Price
verified: Size: Split King SetColor: WhiteVerified Purchase

author: bjmok22
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2019
review_content: I’m not high maintenance with my sheets, all my other sheets are Threshold by Target and in my opinion are much better than these. These sheets are soft like everyone says but they are very thin, which would be great for summer, except they aren’t cotton so they are not breathable and just make you sweat. And in the winter I can’t use them because of the static they cause with every movement due to the polyester material. Even worse if one of my kids with fleece pj sleeps with us, every move causes a spark! They wash well and don’t wrinkle and all that, but I would not recommend these.
title: Polyester just makes you sweat

author: Taylor
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 26, 2018
review_content: Your browser does not support HTML5 video.           I ordered the white striped sheets in size king. The white is a true bright white which I’m very happy with. The stripes have a little shine to them which is elegant.My complaint if I’m being picky is that the sheets barely cover my mattress and mattress topper. I was hoping it would have cover everything perfectly because it says they are deep fitting sheets and will cover up to 16” mattresses. Which mine, with both mattress and mattress topper, is just under 16 inches. I was a bit bummed about that. I’m afraid these will pop off at night like my old ones did. Also, the sheets are a bit transparent. You can see the tag very easily through the pillow case. Again, not a huge deal but I wanted to point it out. I’ll attach photos.You can’t beat the price point for the qaulity though. I’d buy again.
title: Does the job for a great price!

author: Stephanie
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 15, 2020
review_content: I bought these due to both sets of Target Threshold sheets tore on the fitted sheet. I couldn't afford to replace both sets for $80 each so I bought a set of these sheets. I lay in my bed for more than the recommended 8-10 hours.I'm in the middle about these sheets, there are some good items and some bad. I didn't purchase multiple so I don't know about the color. I definitely don't remember about stains - I unpacked them and through them straight in the washer (didn't inspect).  My $80 Target sheets don't have decorative trim on both sides (I think it's due to the flap to hold the pillow secure). I don't know why it's such a big deal - just flip the pillow over.Pro: (1) price - around $30, (2) softness - the material is silky smooth, (3) easy to dry - because they are thin, it hardly takes time to dry, (4) color - it's the color that was shown, but it doesn't match to my comforter.Cons: (1) thin - material is so thin, I feel like they wont last long and create holes, (2) deep pocket - I guess my mattress is over 16" because the corners slip up and don't cover the full mattress, (3) pillows - the flap to secure the pillow isn't firm so it constantly has the pillow fall out.
title: Super Soft

author: Cas
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 13, 2016
review_content: I own three sheet sets from this company. Two of the three were gifts off of my wish list and the latest set in white I ordered for myself after seeing it on sale for $19.70. I'm picky about my bedding. It doesn't matter how pretty they are; if they are not nice and soft I won't use them. This sheet set is nice and soft. The fitted sheet has nice deep pockets and I've never had a problem with the bed sheets coming off the corner. I own these in dark purple, light gray, and my most recent set is  in white. I wish I would have grabbed a second white set while they were on sale as white can go with any bedding color. My purple set is the one I've had for longest: nine months. They have held up great. I wash and use them over my other sheets.  I will definitely order more of these sheets in other colors. If your looking for a soft sheet set with a variety of color choices well not trying to break the bank go ahead and give them a try.
title: The brushed microfiber is nice and soft

author: Sara
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 23, 2020
review_content: When I was a kid, oh hell teen, I remember slipping into my parents bed and feeling like I was in HEAVEN. The sheets were so soft and comfy. When we bought our first house, I bought expensive sheets to mimic that. I was disappointed. They were eh and we paid $90. Okay. I was conned. Another expensive pair. A little better, but not as great. Pilled a few months later. I got frustrated. Thread count obviously no longer indicated quality. Finally I bought these because there were mentioned on several blogs. $33? No way they would be great. Boy was I surprised. They are the softest we have found! Okay, the color though. It must be off. Nope!! Olive green and it is BEAUTIFUL. I saw some reviews saying they were “only okay if you were a college kid”... Ummm I WISH these existed when I was in college. Honestly I’m super impressed. I was very wary of any sheets under $50, “luxury” label, thread counts, reviews, and so glad I took a chance on these. My husband also refused to buy anything “microfiber” but this isn’t what we think of when we think microfiber. Highly recommend. Will update if they pill
title: Take the chance - it pays off! I wasted money on more expensive sheets.

author: Shawn Fitzgibbons
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 21, 2020
review_content: If you like CRISP cool sheets these are NOT for you.  They feel like flannel.  However, they are pretty and fit OK--a little baggy on my 15 inch mattress but what I do not like is that they are just kinda hot.  Sure they are SUPER soft but that is because they are slightly fuzzy.  I would not purchase these again.
title: NIce, but...

author: rudysmom
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 27, 2020
review_content: I came to order another set and see they've gone up nearly $10 in 6 months. Another $10 and I can just get some name brand real cotton ones from Ross or Marshalls. With that being said, they are very soft and keep very cool. I particularly enjoy the pillowcases being smooth because I'm single af and hug my pillows. They also don't pill. Not stain resistant. I have some dirt stains from the dog stuck on them. It was a good buy when they were cheaper. Debating on another set....
title: SO SOFT

author: Patxi
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 17, 2018
review_content: Was a little skeptical about "Microfiber" sheets, mostly because I associate the fabric with cleaning rags. However, I am pleasantly surprised with these sheets!  A few points: > They have a mild plastic-like odor when first out of the package. This disappeared with the first wash. > The fabric is thin, which I would normally think wouldn't last long, but they have actually held up very well. Keep in mind, they are 100% polyester which stands up to wear better than cotton...BUT do NOT iron them or let them run in a hot drier for too long after they are dry. > I was nervous about how the microfiber would feel, but this has turned out to be unfounded. Indeed, these sheets feel like the soft, cotton sheets you might remember as a youngster, that had softened to perfection after having been run through the washer dozens of times; except these have this feel right out of the package! Would definitely buy these again.Would definitely buy these again.
title: Great set of sheets!

author: N. Grimm
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 7, 2017
review_content: This sheet set is super soft and durable. Bought the queen set in olive. We have a foam topper on our mattress which makes it difficult to find sheets that will have proper depth/fit wo slipping off at corners. This set fits perfectly and withstands the spouses aggressive sleep patterns (combat vet w PTSD). Past sheet sets would tear at corner seams...this set has not. There was no smell or anything alarming upon unboxing. Washed the set before using and it held up well (and has several times since) to washer/dryer with no pilling or wrinkling. Sheets do not sleep hot, are luxurious feeling, and worth every penny. Will be buying sets for the kid's beds. Can't argue w price and quality.
title: Cant argue price and quality

author: lucypevensie
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 2, 2020
review_content: The sheets are soft. I did not expect top quality, with the price being so low. The fitted sheets do not fit real tight, though they do stay on the corners, which is good. They're kind of thin, but again, with the low price I was not expecting top quality. One of the sheets has a rip in it, about a third of an inch in diameter. These are only meant to be used temporarily, so it is not necessary to return and get a refund. They'll do the job for now.Actually, I've bought a set of these same sheets before for another bed (from a store, not Amazon) and didn't like those either. I didn't realize until I opened the package and looked at them that they are the same thing. That set did not fit tightly either, and the corners slid off all the time.
title: A little cheap
verified: Size: Split King SetColor: WhiteVerified Purchase

author: Jazzy_jas
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 6, 2020
review_content: I got these about 2 weeks ago, and as soon as I opened the package I could feel how soft they were. Like it's  incredible how soft they are! I put them to wash as soon as I got them and when they came out of the dryer they were still a bit wrinkled. but I couldn't wait to go to bed. Normally I don't like to sleep under sheets and a comforter because it gets too hot but they are actually really fresh. Definitely buying some for my son, and recommend it for all :) P.s good time to buy now during Quarantine because you get to lay in bed all day lol
title: Is it time for bed yet?

author: Heather
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 17, 2020
review_content: I now have 5 sets of these sheets.  I am very impressed at the value for the money.  I generally do not spend a huge amount on sheets because I have 2 dogs and 2 cats that sleep with us and it can be rough on sheets.  That said, these are great.  I have 2 pattern sets and 2 solid.  The colors and patterns were exactly as advertised.  The sheets are soft and so far hold up very well to washing (in both color and comfort).  I have a standard queen sized bed and they fit perfectly.  Fit is often a problem with discount sheet, but not at all with these.  No noticeable smell when new or after washing (my husband is very sensitive to chemical smells, so he would have noticed).  Not sure what is up with the negative reviews.  I have owned very expensive sheets, I have owned crappy sheets.  These cannot be beat for what you are paying.
title: Love these Sheets
verified: Size: QueenColor: Quatrefoil Navy BlueVerified Purchase

author: Sydney Wright
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 17, 2019
review_content: I was really looking forward to getting this sheet set. Shipping was within 1 day. I got them to match my light quilt in black white & red. I did notice right off that they were not a match to the description of black & white. They were more of a charcoal or dark gray as opposed to black. Also, the white was off white, nearly ivory. I decided that I would continue to try them out. I washed them on cold/cold setting & used a color catcher sheet in the cycle. This feature catches any color runs from bleeding. What resulted was the ivory color is now a light gray. What you end up with is basically a 2 toned gray with a slight pattern outline. It defiently doesn't match my bedding. This is just from the appearance aspect. I can't comment as to the other performance quality since I'm not sure how I feel about this purchase. Also, I recommended it to others just off the high reviews & product description.
title: True Colors

author: Jesgrate
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 13, 2020
review_content: I ordered several of these to have wrinkle free sheets and softness.  Blue Hydrangea is supposed to be a medium purplish blue but it really is a dusty light blue color. No purple in it at all.  Totally different.  The "Spa Blue" arrived as a very muted dull green sage color, certainly not a vibrant turquoise as shown.  I might try one more color to see what I get but this is a problem.The Spa Blue color arrived with lots of deep set wrinkles in the fitted sheet and after washing twice in cold water front loader, low dry with a dryer sheet,  the wrinkles are still in the same place.  Guess they are set in the material for life.I do like the embellishment stitching on the pillowcases.  Nice touch and they are soft. Disappointingly though they bunch up when sleeping on them.
title: Color not same as shown

author: Shoe Queen
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 20, 2020
review_content: I am so happy to have found these beautiful, soft sheets at a great price under $40. I purchased two identical sets so I can interchange if something happens to one should my design be discontinued. I wash them weekly in cold water, without fabric softener as recommended, and I can’t imagine they won’t last a long time. I found their customer service very helpful also. I don’t see how you could go wrong. By the way, my expectations were pretty high because of the reviews, even though I have not always agreed with reviews personally; however, this time I was not disappointed. I was not asked by Mellanni nor given a promo to write this.
title: Love These Sheets

author: nerd_up
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 13, 2019
review_content: they function as sheets. but that's about it. you get what you pay for I guess. altho why sheets are so expensive is beyond me. so far the best I've found is target brand. the ones with the special corners that don't pop up. but they're like 60 for king.these feel cheap. and they pick up bleeping everything. they are just constantly covered in lint. that's really hard to get off. I would not recommend these. oh. and they are SUPER loose on my mattress.
title: meh

author: A
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 9, 2020
review_content: I bought queen sized orange bed sheets, advertised as "Mellanni Bed Sheet Set - Brushed Microfiber 1800 Bedding". I like them. These are like 20$-30$ value sheets imo. I dont really know what the 1800 means, bc I seriously doubt these are a high thread count, but they are very soft so the thread count is kinda irrelevant to me for that reason .They are not a thick material as some of the bed sheets I have bought in the stores but they are decent. My mattress measures 16" deep and they just barely fit, I would have expected them to fit and have a little room left over but they work fine. I would not describe these as a "find", but so far they are "fine". I don't regret buying them at all, but there is nothing outstanding about them. The best part is that they are bright orange sheets, which I have never seen before.
title: Decent low cost sheets

author: HMorris
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 12, 2020
review_content: ETA:It is now 4.5 months later and I have tossed these in the trash! Changing my three star to a 2 star. I should be able to use these longer than 4 months.Theae are at a a decent price point. I do not think these work well for my adult preferences, although,  I wouldn’t hesitate putting these sheets on a child’s or teenagers bed. I will only be using these for short time frames While washing my better sheets or in a camper. They came straight out of the package and immediately washed. When I put them on the bed I noticed several darker spots. I did not inspect prior to washing but never had random spots show up on my other sheets. There were random thread problems and the tag was partially attached.  It fell off within a week of use. They are true to size for my king size bed, maybe even taller than some other brands.
title: Spots and thread issues

author: Alyssa Bird
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 15, 2019
review_content: These are by far my favorite set of sheets I have ever bought. I currently have two Mellanni sets and will be ordering more in the future. The colors are so vivid and they feel like you are in the clouds. I used to enjoy Jersey sheets, but they were too hot. These really do well in all temperatures... I don't have to hold off on using them depending on the season. The color seemed slightly different on this set than in the picture, but I still love them. As far as stain-resistance, I am very pleased so far. I have a boyfriend and dogs that sleep in my bed, so naturally our sheets can easily get stained, however these have help their color and they wash really well. No staining thus far! They also feel soft and refreshing every time you get into bed!
title: My favorite sheets

author: E.Lin
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 19, 2018
review_content: The sheets are soft, but I would not call it a slippery silky, but a soft fuzzy silky. They are very thin sheets and will protect nothing from going through.There was a thread cluster on one of my pillow cases. I contacted their support on their home page, and they were very nice about sending me a replacement just the pillow case set.In the replacement set one of the two was mangled even worse than the one I sent in a support ticket about. But that was fine, since in total I still got 2 good pillow cases.If your pillow is super standard (or standard/queen or whatever), your pillow will barely fit, and it will probably start poking out after every sleep.After a single wash the stripes became almost unnoticeable. You probably should not use wanting stripes as a deciding factor like i did.
title: and they were very nice about sending me a replacement just the pillow case ...

author: Melissa D
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 16, 2018
review_content: I’m beyond disgusted to open these sheets today and discover various stains on these sheets!! Not only are there stains but the thread is coming out of the pillowcases, not just loose string. If I were to wash they would completely unravel. I heard about these sheets on a blog and I trusted the opinion of that person. I planned to replace all 4 beds in my home with these sheets but right now I’m pretty irritated. I think I received someone’s used sheets that they returned!!
title: I was sent sheets with stains!!!!

author: jeremy
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2020
review_content: ”Microfiber sheets are breathable, keep moisture away.These luxuries bed sheets stay fresh, cool during hot nights and warm in cold nights - leaving you and your family rested and ready for a new day.The Best Unconditional Lifetime Guarantee, Included For Free!Our 100% no questions asked, no hassle money back or replacement guarantee is the best in the business. Order now!”above is From the description— but these sheets, while soft, are not cool or breathable in any way. Hoping to get some resolution.
title: NOT BREATHABLE OR TEMPERATURE COMFORTABLE

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 18, 2020
review_content: Normally I am not one to leave reviews for products, but these sheets came in yesterday. I washed them, dried them, put them on my bed. I’m not a sheet snob; in fact I’ve never owned “nice” sheets before. The fabric of these sheets moves like water. They are very, very soft and unlike any sheet I’ve ever slept in before. I was worried about the fitted sheet sliding off the corner(s) of my bed, which tends to happen with a lot of the silkier sheets I own. That doesn’t happen. It fits my queen perfectly, if not a little loosely, which is perfect for me.If I were nitpicking, I’d say these sheets do NOT breathe and tend to trap heat. I happen to like the warmth because I live in a colder climate and don’t prefer to sleep with lots of layers on. If you are a hot sleeper, you probably won’t like these. Also, there are a couple places on the sheets where the stitching was bunched up when I first received them. I don’t personally care about that, to be honest. They’re barely noticeable.All in all, I’m happy with my purchase. These are $30 sheets and a great bargain for how comfortable they are. I don’t think I can find better quality for this price.
title: Soft Sheets, Keeps Me Warm = Satisfied Buyer

author: Phoebe
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 14, 2020
review_content: After researching tons of sheets that can "cool" us during the night, we settled with this one....mostly because of the price range. The sheets did come wrinkle free. We put it to use right away on our deep mattress and was surprised that it did fit pretty nicely. But we still attached some straps on to keep the mattress tight. Since purchasing it we noticed we don't get hot flashes as often or wake up sweating. We're not totally cool neither and definitely need the AC still. So we're content with it.I rated it 4 stars because the quality and comfort level simply isn't 5 star level. It is a very nice set of sheets that has a bit of everything, but not the best in everything.
title: Has a bit of everything but not the best.

author: sr33
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 25, 2020
review_content: One of those where I was taken in by glowing description, number of reviews, and ratings. For the price you could do a lot better at TJ- or C o s t c o. Color - Spa Blue was uninspiring, feel of the material was uninspiring.For those who'd say "but its just a sheet, what do you expect", I also got a brushed flannel set from the big C, and just loved that, so it IS possible to be inspired by a bed sheet ;-).Not sure if the great review here are for the colors and designs - I must admit to being spoiled by vibrant colors and vivid, imaginative designs of our handloom sheets from India, so the ones here are all rather ordinary.Returned it.
title: "Meh" about sums it up

author: Lynette
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2020
